Post Body: back during covid read about how buying oximeter could save your life an oximeter is simple device you put on your finger that reads oxygen levels in the blood and typically pulse reading as well picked one up on amazon and tossed it in the drawer thinking ya whatever and that was that fast forward years later and my daughter became very ill my wife and took her to the doctors multiple times and were turned away saying she ll be fine just cold we called the advice nurse over the phone the following evening when she really started laboring breathing and they said it viral issue just leave her home and she ll be fine went and pulled out that little device hadn used in years and tossed it on my daughter she was reading an oxygen level with pulse immediately knew this was dire and she had to go asap to the er and wasn taking no for an answer rushed her to the emergency room and armed with knowledge from the gadget gave them her vitals we bypassed people waiting and they started wrenching on her little body it been almost weeks in the hospital and we are still fighting for her life but remain hopeful hope this information can save life had not used it my daughter probably wouldn be here trust me buy one the best case scenario is you spend and it stays in the drawer never having to be used
Summary: An oximeter is a device that measures the amount of oxygen in your blood. This story details how not owning one could have had tragic consequences but owning one and having it on hand saved a person's life by giving them vital information that allowed them to get life-saving treatment.

Post Body: don have washer and dryer in my apartment dislike when clean socks and especially undergarments fall onto the dirty public floor of the laundry room while removing clothing from the machines found fairly cheap way to keep that from happening it also helps lessen the chance of losing random sock or embarrassingly dropping pair of underwear in the hallway of your building while carrying your basket this shortens your overall laundry time as well less time moving items from the washer to the dryer then the dryer to your laundry basket it quicker sorting and putting away when all the socks and underwear are together most physical and online retailers with laundry section will often sell pack of white mesh bags with zipper they are sometimes labelled for use with lingerie or delicates they come in multiple sizes some for larger items like sweaters purchased bunch of these packs they have color coded zippers as change my clothes dirty socks go into the blue bags undergarments go into green after the bags start to get about halfway full zip it up and start new one as long as you don overstuff your bags the items will have plenty of space to get clean and to dry hopefully this helps some of you

Post Body: banks do stupid things they can close your account for no obvious reason they can put hold on all your funds for suspicious activity your account can be compromised it good practice to bank with multiple providers set up backup bank account and keep some of your emergency funds there just in case better yet use credit unions they have lower fees and are not as predatory as the big banks

Post Body: talkative and extroverted people are far more likely to approach people they don know and start conversations that the whole reason they have lot of relationships it very hard to learn to be extroverted if you re not naturally that way even for those people but especially for introverts asking questions and listening is better strategy for getting people to actually like you and not just tolerate you asking questions and actively listening let people know you find them interesting maintaining eye contact and being attentive allows the other person to feel seen and heard when you make people feel seen heard understood and appreciated they cannot help but have positive feelings about you even if you talk little about yourself you ve told them that you like hearing them talk and you find them interesting you just listen listening also makes conversation but you have to be listening for real not just for the sake of listening in order to be better in that topic if someone is talking about something that they re passionate about all you need to do is listen and show interest ve listened to people for minutes by only nodding every now and then to continue the question pretty much asked for more details about something they said couple of minutes ago charisma is fascinating thing hard to define and pinpoint how to increase it yet we all recognise it most people consider charismatic are really passionate and enthusiastic also it tends to be subject based just because you are hugely charismatic does not mean you can easily talk or communicate charismatically about any subject also helps to be really people focused and interested in them
Summary: It can be difficult for introverts to approach people they don't know and start conversations, but by asking questions and actively listening, they can make themselves more likable. Listening attentively and maintaining eye contact allows others to feel seen and heard, and showing interest in their passions can make someone seem more charismatic, even if they are not talkative or communicate well on other topics. Ultimately, passion and enthusiasm for a subject and focus on others can help someone come across as more charismatic, but this can take practice and may not come naturally to introverts.

Post Body: need to quickly understand the gist of news article without reading the entire piece use generative ai tool like chatgpt or bing here how get the article url copy the link of the news article you want to summarize use the ai tool paste the url into generative ai tool like chatgpt or bing ensure the ai has web browsing capabilities to access the article request summary simply type summarize pasted url and the ai will provide concise summary of the article use news aggregator app if you have news aggregator app share the article directly to the ai tool to get the link you do not even need to open the link example paste exact text into generative ai summarize the generative ai that you re using has to have access to the internet to browse the url that you give it do not use one that does not recently chatgpt re enabled access to the web so now you can do it there alternatively you can use bing
Summary: To quickly get a summary of a news article you can use a generative AI tool like ChatGPT or Bing. First, copy the URL of the article you want to summarize. Ensure that you are using a tool that has web browsing capabilities. Next, paste the URL into the AI tool and request a summary by typing "summarize pasted URL." You should get a concise summary of the article. Alternatively, if you have a news aggregator app, you can share the article directly to the AI tool for a summary. Ensure you are using an AI tool with web browsing capabilities to get the best results.

Post Body: if you live in region that experiences big temperature swings as the seasons change you should be checking your tire pressure whenever they shift when it gets cold your tire pressure will decrease when it gets warm it will increase you ll need to add air in the winter and potentially let air out as it warms low tire pressure negatively affects fuel economy and safety you might want to check behind people you care about mom gf etc if didn maintain my wife car she be in lot of trouble don forget the spare tire and you can find your car specific pressure in the handbook or in the drivers side door frame the rating on the tire is limitation for the tire specifically not pressure recommendation for the vehicle it installed on
Summary: With big temperature swings as seasons change, it's important to check your tire pressure. When it's cold outside, your tire pressure will decrease, and when it's warm, it will increase. You'll need to adjust your tire pressure accordingly to maintain fuel economy and safety. You can find your car's specific pressure recommendation in the handbook or on the driver's side door frame. Don't forget to check your spare tire as well.

Post Body: have not seen this tip anywhere but it one that ve figured out over the years hand washing dishes at home or at work before would just throw my oily tupperware and plastic deli containers into the sink and wonder why it took several passes of soapy water to remove stubborn grease spots from the container what think is happening is twofold thick food oils just sticks to all surfaces regardless of material but they have particularly affinity for sticking to plastic vs ceramic metal or glass it might be something at the chemical level my solution if you wipe your mouth and hands with napkins during your meal use those napkins to wipe off as much grease from the plastic containers first before hand washing if it is particularly greasy container use more napkins or paper towels it will save tremendous amount of soap water and time effort as you can wash your plastic containers using only one round of soapy water you were going to throw out that napkin anyway so give it one more use before it goes this tip also helps with glassware metal cookware and other items to be washed but it is most helpful for plastic containers in my experience
Summary: Doing the dishes can be tedious, here is a tip to make it easier and faster: wipe off grease from containers with napkins or paper towels before washing them in soapy water. This works especially well for oily tupperware and plastic containers. This will save you time and effort, and you'll only need to wash them in one round of soapy water.

Post Body: you ll all see the image of someone they have water in their right ear so they tilt their head to the right and smack the opposite end of their head this barely ever works if you have water in your ear let centrifugal force do it instead just figured this out and it was such satisfying moment

Post Body: scams are more and more rampant every day and they particularly prey on elderly or less tech savvy individuals take the time to talk through the common tactics and how they work the most common examples see are gift card scams refund scams and phishing theyre all fairly simple gift card scam someone or some company you know reaches out to let you know they need you to send them money immediately but the easiest way to do so is by buying apple google visa steam gift cards it is urgent and you need to go right now and get them sometimes its someone impersonating bank or company you information the money is gone forever check zelle refund scam scammer sends you too much money for purchase or simply accidentally sent you funds they ask you to zelle venmo wire them the balance and sometimes let you keep portion for your troubles you see the money in your account so it seems legit you send them the money from your bank account and week later the original transaction is reversed due to fraud you are now on the hook for the amount you sent back to the now untraceable account that is most likely overseas and unrecoverable you also get the added bonus of having your account flagged for fraud and oftentimes locked or completely shut down phishing this one is the most straightforward but even ive nearly fallen for it before someone reaches out claiming to be bank company even the government they give you link and ask you to sign in or even call and ask for your credentials the phone call popped up as chase bank in caller id the email looks legit and the link takes you to site that looks just like theirs you put in your stuff and they take over to avoid this just always always go to the website yourself and log in then try to navigate to the page they asked for or ask for transfer extension and call back through the main corporate line theres reason every single legit email phone message etc clearly says that they will never ever call you to ask for your Summary:
Scams are becoming more and more prevalent in today's society, and often target elderly or less tech-savvy individuals. It's important to be aware of common tactics, such as gift card scams, refund scams, and phishing, and to educate yourself and others on how to recognize them. By understanding these tactics and sharing this knowledge, you can help protect yourself and your loved ones from financial loss and emotional harm. 

Remember, if someone reaches out to you asking for urgent financial assistance, gift cards should be a red flag. It's always best to verify the request through a known, trusted channel, such as a face-to-face conversation or a phone call using a verified number. Never provide personal or financial information in response to an unsolicited request, and always verify the authenticity of any communication before taking any action.

Post Body: just attack the dirt or grime at shallow angle and after few passes almost anything will come off use this on glass cookware metal cookware where do not mind scratches stone countertops even vynal or wood as long as you do not go sideways to the grain especially if it varnished or laqored the crud will come off and you can just wipe it off with single dry paper towel then come in for final pass with soap and water save the razor blade for next time and use fewer disposable sponges rags when all is said and done find this to be much less gross way of cleaning my kitchen

Post Body: the problem many of us face when we set out to create change within our lives is losing trust within ourself our mind keeps mental tally of all the things we tell ourselves we re going to do and either builds up or breaks down trust depending upon the result for instance if out of no where we make the plan to go to the gym for an hour everyday for the next month without any prior consistency in working out we ll soon find ourselves missing day then two then abandoning the plan all together our mind becomes confused and loses trust in our own words when we re unable to stick to them this creates mental narrative along the lines of incapable or it must not be for me which soon becomes the go to language we speak to ourselves if instead we initially set the intention to go to the gym once week for minutes we may not find our physical muscles growing but we will find our mental muscle growing this mental muscle is what dictates our sense of character and ability to do hard things after month of weekly minute workouts at the gym we can very slowly stack more time more frequency and eventually expand this into new activities and skills we re looking to develop some people will say going to the gym once week for minutes what the point in that the point is that when we stick to our plans we develop confidence an inner trust that says capable of doing the things tell myself to do from this confidence we begin stacking one success upon another which further ingrains this inner trust the game of developing as human is all about mindset start small take small steps and before you know it you will see astonishing results
Summary: When you struggle to stick to your plans, it's easy to feel like you can't trust yourself. To build trust, start with small goals you can achieve, like going to the gym for a short amount of time once a week. By following through on these smaller goals, you build up your mental "muscle" and increase your confidence and sense of capability. This makes it easier to achieve bigger goals down the line. Remember, the key is to start small and be patient with yourself. Ultimately, developing self-trust is key to achieving your goals and creating lasting change.

Post Body: if you have ever tried to find out how to say word correctly in another language you might have gotten something like this it like the in ther the is like the in this might look right to the untrained eye but these are actually mostly wrong you might also see things like maw cuh sin for moccasin these also seem like good guides but they do not come without flaws that is where the ipa can come in the ipa writes down sounds objectively it transcriptions come from the actual ways that the mouth moves lot of ipa symbols are exactly what you think they are so it makes learning easier going back to the first example word that is often misconstrued might be hemos from spanish people teaching will probably just say that it like the in but it different vowel that english does not use like how spanish does bed in ipa is but hemos in ipa is mos these vowels differences can give out that you do not actually know how to say the word correctly to people who are more familiar with it here are some sample words in ipa these are based on american english fun it lake le you can find transcriptions of almost any word on it wiktionary page
Summary: If you are trying to learn how to enunciate words in a new language, IPA can help you by making explicit the sounds in words by using symbols that represent mouth movements. This is superior to relying on guides that might look similar to the word you are trying to learn, but are actually misrepresentations. You can look up almost any word on Wiktionary to find its IPA transcription.

Post Body: live in the northeast and will be out for entire months of december january the house will be totally empty what is the checklist to make sure everything is in good shape in the house got security cameras but am not sure how else can keep the place safe also what else must do so that house stays in good shape
Summary:
If you will be away from your home for an extended period of time, there are several steps you should take to ensure that your house is well-maintained and secure. 

Firstly, double-check that all doors and windows are locked and secure. Consider notifying your neighbors of your absence and ask them to keep an eye on your home. You can also notify police or security services of your absence, especially if the house will be empty for an extended period of time. 

To keep your home in good shape, you should turn off all appliances, except for any that are necessary for maintaining a safe environment (such as a freezer). You should also adjust your thermostat to keep your home at a temperature that prevents your pipes from freezing. Hire a plumber to winterize your home if you anticipate very low temperatures. 

If you have any indoor plants, consider finding someone to care for them while you are away. You should also avoid posting about your trip on social media or telling many people about your absence, as this can indicate to potential burglars that your home will be empty.

that just happened and as information consumers the public can eventually lose touch with how irregular the news that they read actually is think it applies the most to the agoraphobic the socially isolated and those who read history books like hers that are chock full of terrible past events the good news is not often in the news because it important to draw attention to the biggest problems so they can be addressed if you look only at the headlines you are at risk of missing they beauty within the status quo there is multitude of possible problems that were addressed or successfully averted by the community simply going to work and being decent to each other if people are hurt you would buy the paper to figure out if your family is ok the news media knows that violence is going to get the most attention and as society we would attack any news source that gave top billing to anything other than the worst news of yesterday do not think it wrong to lead with the worst thing but it it important to know who is suffering and how as well as who is doing what about it it also important to celebrate the fact more people are eating and laughing and loving than ever before when there greater than the effect of the disturbance
Summary: According to Tuchman's law, the news will always focus on the worst thing that happened, which leads to an distorted view of reality. Summary:
There are several ways to remind yourself to do something, such as putting a note on your pillow, putting objects that you need to take with you or do something with, like your lunch box by the door, or using an alarm or to-do list app on your phone.

Object on the pillow is probably the easiest to do if you are already in bed and have an important task you must not forget in the morning, like taking an medication with you. 

Putting objects that you need in a certain place, like your keys or lunch box, by the door, can be an effective way to make sure you don't forget them when you leave the house. 

Using reminders and to do list apps on your phone can be effective but relying on remembering to check your phone and properly interpret the reminder or to do list can be fallible if you are not careful. 

Writing notes to yourself or using sticky notes can be very effective but requires more effort and may not be sustainable long term if you have lots of tasks and responsibilities. 

The most important thing is to find a system that works for you and that you will stick to.

Post Body: super glue is decent glue but it won work in all situations without diving too much into the theory behind it here quick question to ask yourself before fixing something with super glue did this break during normal use if the answer is yes don try fixing it with super glue for example say you had container with handle if one day you lifted the container by the handle one too many times and the handle snapped off don use super glue to reattach the handle however if you re carrying the container and you hit it against something and the corner chips off you could glue the corner back and have reasonably good chance of the repair holding up super glue isn as strong as the name implies it generally leaves whatever you fixed weaker than it was originally and it not good for sustained stress if you re fixing something that broke under normal level of stress like the handle in the above example that same normal stress will break super glue almost instantly either use epoxy add something that will reinforce the handle and add mass and strength to it or replace the handle entirely but if the repair isn expected to normally take lot of weight or stress like something that broke under an unexpected blow then super glue might hold up better there generally something better than super glue for repairs but it has its uses and it seems like it always around it easier to keep tube of super glue around than epoxy that needs new mixing tip every time you use it but know its limitations and you ll be less likely to have to repair something twice
Summary: Super glue can be a good solution for repairing some broken items, but it is not always the best choice. Before using super glue to fix something, it is important to consider whether the break was due to normal use, as super glue is not designed to withstand sustained stress or heavy loads. In cases where a repair is likely to encounter high levels of stress or strain, super glue may not be strong enough and a more durable fix, such as epoxy or a replacement part, may be necessary. Additionally, super glue can weaken the integrity of the original material, making it more prone to future breaks. Understanding the limitations of super glue can help ensure more successful repairs.

Post Body: avoid buying cars from recently flooded states this is something people should be aware of do not buy cars that are from someplace recently flooded anything registered in ny or nv during the floods should be avoided at all cost used to work for dealership and the service department kept getting cars for months after the big floods here people would buy them for good deal and not have them checked my senior tech told me that he always sees out of state cars from places that flood as well we had newer car come in after and it obviously flooded owner just wanted our most expensive detail and did not want any services we knew he was going to sell it to some chump like total pos but it was not our job to fix the world just the cars check carfax for history they might not have been totalled check where they were located get them checked prior to buying by mechanic even if you take it to mechanic look under the carpet seats undercarriage places that do not typically get deep details cleaned
Summary: Do not buy a car that has been registered in Nevada or New York, or any other car that has been recently flooded. Check the car's history through Carfax, and regardless of the report, have the car inspected by a trusted mechanic before purchasing. Look for signs of flooding in places that do not get deep detailing cleaned regularly, such as under the carpet, seats, and undercarriage.

Post Body: this lpt is for those of us shopping in the inexpensive tier particle board or mdf medium density fiberboard is saw mill waste sawdust held together with glue particle board furniture is often just slightly cheaper than solid wood but the downsides are huge pb is very flimsy you re very likely to find broken part in the box and if not have one break during assembly pb furniture assembly will likely take much longer than solid wood because the flimsy material requires lot more hardware the resulting piece will be heavier than solid wood because of all the glue holding the sawdust particles together yet it will have lower weight limits whereas wood can be painted pb requires veneer that will eventually start to peel off always use the solid wood filter when shopping the big sites for furniture bonus stay far away from bonded leather furniture those leather chairs will look like trash as soon as the warranty expires buy fake leather or fabric instead edit for all those complaining that wood is very expensive and saying things like be rich it simply not true do quick search on homedepot for beds filter by material solid wood first not just wood that trick look at the prices then do the same with material particle board pb beds start at solid wood it just that furniture manufacturers prey on people who do not know any better and only pay attention to price and appearance hence the lpt
Summary: When buying furniture, avoid particle board or MDF medium density fiberboard as it is essentially saw mill waste sawdust glued together. Particle board furniture is cheaper but tends to be flimsy, breaks easily, takes longer to assemble, is heavier than solid wood but has lower weight limits, and requires veneer that will eventually peel off. Solid wood furniture may initially appear more expensive, but it is more durable and lasts longer. Additionally, stay away from bonded leather furniture and go for fake leather or fabric instead.

2. Use inexpensive spirits like vodka, gin or rum with a mixer like soda water or juice to offer cocktails affordably. Buying liquor in bulk is cheaper than offering a variety of bottled beers and wines.

5. Plan your menu ahead of time to avoid stress and prep what you can before your event.

Post Body: every meeting you schedule and accept should have an agenda and the agenda can just be general miscellaneous meeting at the end of the month or quarter covering unrelated topics is fine do not schedule meeting to discuss that you should have meeting in the future about issue or that you put on the calendar as directed but then never followed through if you are unprepared for meeting that is already scheduled reschedule it for time when you are ready to have fleshed out conversation with support if you have standing meeting with certain clients partners or colleagues but there is nothing of significance to address then make it an email with highlights lowlights use your free time to catch up on work or take the opportunity to check in with smaller client who usually gets overlooked you never know where your next professional achievement might come from and may fail to realize those smaller clients are ready to expand in way that benefits you always check the list of invitees if you have high level execs on either side in attendance then you better be prepared to conduct productive meeting if you re unsure what expected out of the meeting then ask ahead of time every meeting especially with level executives calling in should have an end goal rarely do they just sit in for no reason fridays are for catching up on work and for projects requiring extra focus do not schedule meetings on friday unless they re timely or scheduling conflicts don leave another option afternoons are especially off limits unless there an urgency cannot express enough how poorly it reflects on the colleague department and company when meeting has zero direction and people on either side are unprepared it insulting to be invited to such meeting and shameful to those responsible on their teams for the continued lack of progress and clarity on project or issue
Summary: Before scheduling or accepting any meeting invite, make sure to check if there is an agenda for the meeting. If you are scheduling a meeting, but you are not prepared, then reschedule it unless you have a standing meeting with the attendees and there are no significant items to address. Be sure to send it via email in that case. Fridays are not suitable for scheduling meetings, unless they are urgent, and the afternoon times are usually off limits. Post Body: retired now but worked in silicon valley for years here are couple of things that found is useful in landing job at startup my observations also apply to people who are not engineers what this is about is finding out where smart money goes and following it first find out who the venture capital firms are that back the kind of companies you re looking for frequently vc firms will specialize in particular areas like biotech for example much googlation will be necessary once you ve figured out which vc firm you want go visit their website in virtually all cases they will have portfolio of the companies they are backing take note of the companies and of course their websites visit the company websites and go to the careers area have look at the kind of jobs they re offering the rest is up to you remember the tricky thing about startups is almost all of them fail so beware by using this approach you can be sure that at least someone with money and supposedly business sense has thought it good idea to invest in them good luck
Summary: If you are looking to get a job at a startup, a good place to look would be the venture capital (VC) firms that fund startups. Post Body: there are in most key systems two ways to make hotel room key cards you can create key which is what done when you check in and that wipes all previous guest keys from the lock either at the moment of creation for online locks or when you first use them for offline locks you can alternatively duplicate keys which just creates copy of the original key that lock treats as the same if you get duplicate key whoever finds your old keys can still use them to access the room if they have way to figure out which room they go to if you get re created key then all the existing guest keys stop working yes this may annoy people you re traveling with but it the safer route the reason key duplicates exist is purely for guest convenience it so if one person forgets their room key everybody does not have to get new room keys but it big security risk for lost keys also make sure you engage the deadbolt switch some locks have separate deadbolt lever some do it by turning the door handle straight up this will typically disable all keys including most staff keys except for security emergency keys it not always physical deadbolt but it still works like one night latches the bar things if you re staying somewhere that still has them will make you feel better but do not offer much security side channel physical security devices like the velco strap that wraps around the handle deadbolt or dead bolting night latching and stuffing towels around each to prevent under door tools will increase your security so if you re traveling with highly sensitive information like electronic devices with highly sensitive information or potentially dangerous things like firearm they may be worth the trade off of denying emergency access how you weigh them is up to you if you do have special security needs talking to the hotel ahead of time can mitigate lot of those tradeoffs anyways stay safe avoid dangerous people and places never defend property and if confronted act decisively and escape edit forgot to say if you do lose your room key it usually not possible or it should not be possible to tell which room in hotel that key goes to some hotels do encode the room number into the key with some proprietary system but it still just encoded so not secure just hopefully secret so they can identify keys later it the the room number that encoded with some proprietary whatnots the actual information to that opens the door is encrypted which is different thing hopefully and well designed systems will identify wandering intruders and deactivate key entirely if it used on more than usually wrong doors so you cannot just keep walking down hallways to find out where it works
Summary:
There are two ways that hotel room keys can be made. You can have a key created, which wipes all previous guest keys from the lock, or you can get a duplicate key. Duplicate keys create a copy of the original key that the lock treats as the same. Neither option is better than the other, it is more a matter of guest convenience. 

If you lose your key, there is no need to worry because it should not be possible to tell which room the key goes to. Overall, hotel key systems are designed to keep guests safe.

Post Body: my take is there are four categories of stuff stuff that means something to you keep stuff that means something to someone else mostly toss donate stuff that has monetary value sell stuff that is still useful mostly keep anything that has sentimental value to you personally old toys heirlooms photos is stuff you should keep but bear in mind that most of that stuff becomes with the next generation stuff that meant something to someone else but does not really mean much to you is good candidate for tossing donating most of your parents or grandparents furniture probably belongs in this category same thing with most kitchenware and some clothing souvenirs from trips and knick knacks probably belong here as well in some cases there is stuff that has real monetary value and would be worthwhile to sell properly some antiques jewelry paintings etc anything that can be sold at garage sale for or less may not be worth the hassle and finally anything you inherit that is still useful should be kept the most obvious example are tools and some household items simple stuff like brooms laundry baskets etc these things really have an unlimited life as long as they do not break and can still serve valuable purpose for anyone interested there was an article in today wall street journal that addressed this topic agree with the reporter claim that today generation has less of an attachment to physical items than previous generation which makes this more complicated
Summary: Keeping the possessions that mean something to you and selling or giving away things that no longer hold value to you is a sensible way to approach decluttering. Sentimental items, antiques, jewelry, and other valuables can be sold for a good price. However, there are some items, such as kitchenware, clothing, and furniture that may have been valuable to someone else but don't necessarily have the same worth for you, and it would be wise to donate or toss them.

Post Body: found that have great conversations with people at parties but even though we exchanged numbers never really know how to follow up and turn it into friendship asking for recommendation during the conversation and then following up after has worked really well for me benefits here in the moment when you ask people love talking about themselves and they appreciate the opportunity to share something that brought them joy or meaning the followup can literally happen anytime days or even weeks after just if it been while you might have to jog their memory bit most important imo you taking their recommendation makes them feel heard remembered and taken seriously it provides the perfect topic for future conversation in sharing thoughts and opinions at the very least you could get some pretty good content out of this lot of my favorite songs have been random recommendations from people this of course will not work all the time and friendships require more than just one piece of content in common to sustain them but ve found this is good way to get the ball rolling
Summary: Having great conversations with new people at parties is easy, but turning these acquaintances into friends can be tricky. While sharing recommendations may not alone build a lasting friendship, it is a great way to create a foundation for future conversations and foster potential friendships.

Post Body: this is simple yet powerful and underestimated by most people when feeling stressed or anxious before significant event focusing on your breath can be powerful and immediate technique to regain composure by directing your attention to your breath you anchor yourself in the present moment observing the natural rhythm of your breath as it goes in and out serves as mindfulness anchor diverting your mind from spiraling anxious thoughts as you breathe you create calming space within activating the body relaxation response this not only reduces stress but also helps to clear your mind enhance concentration and instill sense of inner balance making you better equipped to approach the impending event with composed and clear mindset was impressed when first stumbled upon these lines by sadh guru anything yields to you only to the extent you pay attention to it in this context your breath is beautiful device because it is always on
Summary: When feeling stressed or anxious, focusing on your breath is a simple, yet powerful tool. Paying attention to your breath serves as a anchor in the present moment, which helps divert your mind from anxious thoughts. It activates the body's relaxation response, reducing stress and clearing your mind, allowing you to approach the impending event with composure and a clear mindset.

Post Body: large greens that you get in bunch like kale and chard you should cut small portion of the ends off and then wrap wet paper towel around the end and rubber band it before putting in fridge if they begin to wilt pull them out and submerge the end in water bath for hours and make sure the leaves get some water too unless they re completely gone they will puff right back up and become firm just like when you bought them cilantro and basil should be washed and the stem placed in cup with some water and plastic bag over the leaves to keep the moisture in bunch will stay good in the fridge for many weeks change the water every few days when saving cut apple pear or similar fruit squeeze bit of lemon or lime juice on the flesh and store in an airtight container it will save in the fridge for several days without browning berries should be washed in homemade vinegar washbath with cups water and tablespoons acv and dried well and stored in an breathable container in the fridge not the coldest spot as soon as you spot berries bananas and other non citrus fruit starting to spoil put them in mason jar in your freezer to keep for pancakes smoothies sauces etc save your scraps for broth if you cook with onions garlic carrots celery tomato and fresh herbs save all of the ends tops and wasted bits to make veggie broth get ideally half gallon contain for your freezer and set aside scraps when chopping and freeze windfall pull out scraps and boil in big soup pot for to hours with some salt and strain this broth is fantastic for cooking beans rice and soups instead of buying expensive store bought broth but skip the brassica family they generally do not fare well in broth cabbage broccoli cauliflower kale do you have economical food tips to help you more out of what you buy at the store throw them in the comments
Summary: To make sure your greens last as long as possible, cut off the ends and wrap them in a wet paper towel before storing them in the fridge. Herbs like cilantro and basil should be placed in a cup with water and covered with a plastic bag. For cut fruits, lemon or lime juice will keep them from browning. Wash berries in a vinegar bath to keep them fresh. Freeze fruit that's about to go bad in a mason jar. Save your food scraps to make homemade veggie broth.

Summary:
Make sure you have all relevant information at hand before you make a call to customer service. 

Be wary of incoming calls and ask for a way to verify the identity of the person on the other end, such as a one-time passcode sent to your phone number or an account number you can find on your latest bill. 

Do not give out personal information to strangers who call you. 

Always hang up if you feel that something is off, and call back a number you find independently, such as on the back of your credit card. 

Speak clearly and stay close to the receiver when you're on speakerphone. 

End the call manually to ensure it's disconnected, and do not discuss personal details once you've ended the call.

Post Body: this is based on my experience with netflix the cost of netflix has basically doubled in last years and there are many months where do not use it and switch with other streaming services so instead of having continuous membership basically subscribe it for month and immediately cancel it within next few minutes since have subscribed and paid can still use it for the rest of the month so there are two possibilities at the end of the paid month you want to continue watching it in this case it is only click to renew your netflix subscription and netflix basically maintains your history as well so all you need is one additional click at the end of the paid month you are no longer using netflix because you are watching something else in that case netflix subscription is cancelled and you save all the subscription cost till you use it again this is based on my personal experience and it can definitely vary for others based on their usage save close to year by following this tip across streaming services edit thanks everyone for sharing your opinions do see lot of them suggesting piracy even though the corporations are charging lot of money for subscriptions all the content we watch and pay for indirectly goes to the numerous artists technicians who put it in the effort to sustain their daily life just my opinion that instead of going into piracy we can minimize and pay just for the amount that we use
Summary:
The price of Netflix has significantly increased over the past few years. Many subscribers have noticed they don't stream content monthly as they used to. Instead of paying for a continuous subscription, some users subscribe for a month, watch the content they intended to, and then cancel their subscription before the next payment cycle. This way, they still get to watch their show or movie while saving money on the subscription costs. 
This is based on my personal experience, and others may have different perspectives on how to save on streaming services. Some suggest piracy, but I believe in supporting the artists and technicians who create the content by paying for what we use.  We can still save money by only paying for what we watch instead of subscribing to multiple services continuously. 
Edit: Thanks to everyone for sharing their ideas. I have noticed many suggestions about piracy, which is not legal. All the content we pay for goes to the artists and technicians who put effort into creating it.  I suggest we pay for what we consume rather than turn to piracy. 

Netflix doubled their prices in recent years and aware many subscribers don't utilize their subscription monthly. Some subscribers have found a workaround to save on their subscription costs.

Post Body: have you ever gone from one room to another and then forgot why you re there of course you have everyone has well that called the doorway effect avoid the doorway effect by saying the thing going to do before leave the room saying it is important but mumble under your breath is good enough just say it once or twice and it ll stick repeating it in your head also works but you ll need to do it lot more than once or twice for some reason actually saying makes it stick faster building the habit is the hard part but it just one thing to remember instead of lot of things and once you have the habit you ll do it every time it worked for me
Summary: Everyone has experienced forgetting why they went into a room or why they were about to do something. To avoid this, say what you're about to do out loud before you do it, or repeat it in your head several times. It's easier to build a habit of doing it every time than to try to remember every detail every time. Saying it out loud helps you stick to your intention faster than keeping it in your head.

Dedicating focus and attention to priority tasks will increase the likelihood of success and reduce the worry about time. Using prioritization and planning, it is possible to manage many tasks and feel accomplished. 

Moving into a new house, attending to a family member who was sick, and delivering an important project are examples of multiple responsibilities that can be managed through effective prioritization and planning. By identifying the most important tasks and allocating time accordingly, it is possible to achieve goals and manage multiple responsibilities. 

Effective time management leads to increased productivity and reduced stress. By focusing on the most important tasks first, you can ensure that critical projects are completed on time and to a high standard. This can help you feel more confident and in control of your workload, reducing stress and helping you to manage your responsibilities more effectively. 

Overall, effective time management through prioritization is a key skill for achieving success and feeling more confident and in control of your life.

Post Body: most people do not start researching pet euthanasia and or emergency pet medical care until their pet is older or really ill depending on those circumstances it can be really stressful and exhausting to be navigating that for the first time while processing the grief of what you are doing do not wait carve out minutes when you get chance and familiarize yourself with your emergency pet hospitals and various euthanasia options in your area program numbers into your phone save shortcuts to directions on your home screen bookmark links lot of people suggest at home pet euthanasia services when the time comes like lap of love agree they are wonderful and dignified option but know in advance what organizations are available in your area their general cost and notice they need some vet offices will do at home services as well one thing that surprised me with lap of love in my area is they rarely can do last minute appointments had to wait an extra day than wanted with cat and would have called earlier if had known that plan for cost as well depending on the service and the options you choose it could be several hundred dollars we paid for in home euthanasia for cat in hcol area and that was without any add ons like getting his ashes back not everyone has the ability to save money specifically for this especially in this economic climate but at least mentally preparing can help if you do have the ability to carve out some of that money to save your future self will be grateful that way you do not have to be stressing about cost on top of pet grief again do not wait even if you have cute little puppy or kitten at home that you hope will live another years it way easier to do now when you re not grieving wreck and you never know when an injury or sudden illness can force you to make that choice far earlier than expected
Summary: It is important to research in advance what options you have for euthanizing your pet, as well as the cost of various services. Post Body: paper napkins and towels are interleaved so that when you put them in the correct type of dispenser pulling out one pulls out the next one partway ready to be taken in free stack not in dispenser this is annoying because it hard to take just one off the top or to take small stack of few since the last napkin or towel is entangled with the first one on the remaining pile and causes the pile to fly all over the place putting the free stack in small tray with rubber band as shown above you can pull the top napkin off which will pull the second one up with it but the rubber band will hold the rest of the stack in place
Summary: Paper napkins and paper towels sometimes come in stacks where napkins or towels are interleaved so that when you pull one out, the next one is partially pulled out as well, which can be annoying if you want to take just one napkin or a few from the top of the stack. A solution is to put the stack in a small tray and hold it in place with a rubber band. This way, when you pull one napkin, the next one will pop up, but the rest of the stack will remain in place.

Post Body: most people are unaware of this but ems cannot enter your home without permission unless they can see you in your home fallen or in need of assistance even then if the door is locked they will need to call police or fire to gain entry and that can waste time so your medical alert system is useless to you if you fall or have an emergency your alarm is going off the house is locked up tight and they can hear or see you can tell you how many times arrived on the scene of medical alert call when worked ems to find blaring alarm dark house and no sign of anyone and just had to call in that we couldn hear or see anyone and left the first time it happened was shocked asked what would happen if someone was inside they said the company would try to reach the homeowner and if it kept going off might eventually send police or fire to gain entry if they thought they needed to but it could also just be false alarm all could think was that it could be very likely that an older person was laying inside in the dark needing assistance but we couldn hear or see them in order to get in with the house locked up tight and no signs of anyone in the house we had no right to enter if we saw or heard someone we could ve called police or fire but that could take time and if someone was unconscious or struggling they couldn call for help nor would we be able to hear them over the sound of the alarm this makes the medical alarm completely useless so make sure that you have way for ems to gain entry in these circumstances and give instructions to your medical alert company to give to ems when they make the call of the alarm going off whether it hidden key lockbox garage or door code whatever make sure they can get to you because it could make the difference between them being able to save your life or just leaving you for dead
Summary: EMS can't enter your home without your permission, so if you have a medical emergency and you've locked them out, they may not be able to help you in time. Post Body: not lawyer and this is not legal advice but functionally they can claim you misunderstood or it was contingent on various events happening decided to post after reading all the stories of companies promising to make up shortfalls if the stock declined etc and then surprise surprise did not bonus tip also true when buying car house or other agreement that has signed contract if you have signed contract as far as aware and per judge judy it takes precedence over what you talked about edit for the lawyers who think otherwise while an oral agreement is enforceable tell me if that is true when there is an existing written agreement offer letter employment handbook and most importantly how you would overcome the employer lying or remembering things differently additionally would not the employee need to expend money and or time to have shot of recovering so if your point is well actually you do not understand how the real world works for the majority of the population
Summary:
Companies can take advantage of oral agreements when dealing with employees and consumers. It is easier for them to misinterpret oral agreements, claim misunderstandings, or state that the agreement was contingent on certain events. Written contracts signed by both parties take precedence over oral agreements and cannot be disputed unless there is evidence of fraud or misrepresentation. 

Employees who wish to dispute their oral agreements with their employers face challenges exacerbated by the necessity of expending time and resources. This situation leaves employees vulnerable and emphasizes the importance of understanding oral agreements' actual legal standing. 

Ultimately, this is a reminder that people must thoroughly understand and document any agreement they make to protect themselves from potential abuse.

Post Body: saw this tip few years ago and it worked so well for me thought pass it along now create journal diary of your workouts recording sets reps weight time anything you felt good or bad during the workout anything you want just get into the habit of committing to certain number of workouts per week and to writing them down struggled for years with getting into the habit of regular fitness training start something and stick with it for few weeks or even months only to drop off for whatever reason excuse saw this tip on lpt sometime in late and in january started new program and thought if give the journal thing go just write down the date the version of the program was working on then list out each exercise the reps sets the weight or band strength and maybe note anything noticed during could not do full rom knees hurting or felt too easy up the resistance next time if had the do not want to work out today thought had to think about what write in the diary this was enough to push me to do something that day half assed workout is still better than nothing if sick or injured still go through the motions of the workout if hungover write down that half assed it but still do something the only break ve had in my habit is recent week trip overseas as soon as got home got right back to my routine this has helped me create the habit of working out at least times per week up to days week when my pt put me on an intense rehab program after an injury without fail in spite of all the excuses used to come up with hopefully it helps someone out there too
Summary:
Keeping a workout journal can help you stay consistent with your fitness training by holding you accountable for your workouts and helping you track your progress. It can also help you identify setbacks or issues, such as injuries or lack of motivation, so you can address them and get back on track. Additionally, writing down your exercises, sets, reps, and weights can help you stick to a program and make progress toward your goals. 

Keeping a workout journal can be as simple as writing down the exercises you completed, the number of sets and reps, and any other relevant details, such as the weight used or how you felt during the workout. Committing to a certain number of workouts per week and writing them down can help you develop a regular fitness training habit. 

Working out even when you're not feeling your best, such as when you're sick or hungover, can help you stay on track and maintain your habit. Keeping a workout journal can be a helpful tool in achieving your fitness goals and developing a consistent workout routine.

Post Body: rental car companies want you to use the pass that in the car but then they charge you all of your tolls plus an exorbitant daily fee we just had three week trip with tolls on day and day and no tolls in between had we let the car company handle the tolls we have paid in daily fees on top of our paltry in tolls but we did not you can easily find out which system is in place lot of the east coast is on ezpass all of california is on fastrak not just road tolls express lanes bridges some parking spots you can go to their web site and create an account and add the license plate of the rental car into the account then just fly through the electronic toll lanes and your tolls will be deducted and the rental car company can find some other way to cheat you remember when you turn in the rental car to delete it from your electronic tolling account if you had tolls that day that have not posted yet remove the license plate from the account anyway the system is smart enough to deal with that ll leave it for you to sort out but just know that your home toll tag probably does not work elsewhere as an example texas has system most of the east coast has different system california has another system and none of these accepts toll tags from any of the others you might start with the wikipedia page services require you to always have at least one license plate registered you can put your car from home even though you will not be driving it on this vacation ezpass also requires you to have at least one toll tag the transponder box that goes on your windshield if you sign up early enough you can bring it along and not have to register your rental license plate and yes your passenger can create toll system account using their phone while you drive down the road toward your first toll plaza but who wants to start their vacation with that sort of stress
Summary:
Rental car companies will charge you exorbitant fees if you use their toll pass. It is smarter and cheaper to set up an account with the tolling system of the state you will be driving in and register your rental car's license plate with them. This can be done online. Be sure to delete the license plate from your account once you are finished with your rental car. 

Different states have different tolling systems, and licenses from one state do not work in another system.

Post Body: if you look at your hot water tank you ll see bolt head flush with the top of the tank that bolthead is foot long piece of magnesium that sits in the water it prevents the steel of the tank from rusting because it corrodes first google sacrificial anode once it is spent the tank can start to rust rust in the tank sends sediment into your pipes and can make the burner work too hard lowering the efficiency replacing it is matter of unscrewing and removing the existing anode wrapping some teflon tape around the threads of the new anode and screwing the new piece in to add read your equipment user manual or contact the manufacturer for instructions on how to do this for your hot water tank edit it takes cold water and makes it hot once it is hot it keeps it hot ergo hot water heater or just dumbass
Summary: If you have a hot water tank, there is a foot long piece of magnesium sitting in your water that prevents the steel of the tank from rusting. This is called a sacrificial anode, and once it is spent, the tank can start rusting and sediment may enter your pipes. Contact the manufacturer for instructions on how to replace the anode in your particular hot water tank.  Conversely, a water heater takes cold water and heats it up, keeping it hot, hence the name.

Post Body: ve heard too many friends either get very excited or disappointed because of how their weight changed from one day to the next but that the problem our weight fluctuates lot over the course of day what and how much you ate and drank how often you went to the bathroom what you wore when you weighed yourself what you had in your pockets etc to get more accurate look at how your nutrition is treating you weigh yourself everyday and write it down do this for week now get the average for those days add them all up and divide by now do it again the following week and compare them doing rd week will give you an even better sample size what happened did your weight go up down stay the same now you can get better idea of how fast slow your weight is changing and what you need to change if anything but remember in the end you should be seeking to look and feel better rather than hyperfocusing on numbers
Summary:
If you want to know how your diet is affecting your body, you should weigh yourself daily and keep a record. Compare the averages of your weight from week to week to get a better idea of how your weight is changing. Remember that the important thing is to look and feel better, not to focus on the numbers. 

This can help you determine what changes you need to make to your diet and exercise routine. 

Factors that can affect the accuracy of daily weigh-ins include: 

- What you ate and drank 
- How often you went to the bathroom 
- What you wore 
- What was in your pockets 

These factors can affect your weight by several pounds, which is why it's important to keep a consistent schedule for weighing yourself. 

Recording your daily weight can also help you identify any patterns or trends in your weight gain or loss, which can be helpful in making changes to your diet and exercise routine.

Post Body: if you re unlucky enough to be in store with delayed egress doors they will require you to hold the bar for around seconds then wait about seconds before the door unlocks all while sounding localized alarm at the door specifically designed to bring attention to the door for staff to intercept shoplifters or trespassers you can try pulling the fire alarm to override this system but this would also cause everyone else in the building who is unaware of the shooter to stream out into the hallways potentially putting much more people at risk make sure that the emergency door you found has no alarm linked to it if so you may be better off hunkering down and laying low edit sure that these doors are legally required to have sign explicitly saying that an alarm will be triggered if these doors are opened so that the type of stuff to look out for
Summary:
If you find yourself in a store with delayed egress doors, you will need to hold the bar for approximately 10 seconds, followed by a further 10 second wait before the door unlocks. This delay is accompanied by an alarm to draw staff attention to potential shoplifters or trespassers. However, this can also prove hazardous in the event of an active shooter situation. 

It is advisable to search for an emergency door without an alarm link and lay low if possible, unless there is a sign stating the door will trigger an alarm upon opening.

Post Body: my current job went full time in office and it is killing me between the commute and the office just being overall uncomfortable am currently job hunting and am worried that if take hybrid position the new job will stab me in the back in the future is there anything should look for in job listing ask in interviews or reasonably request in an offer letter to reduce the risk of my next job pulling stunt like my current employer
Summary:
You are uncomfortable with your current job requiring you to be in the office full time and want to hunt for a more flexible position, but you are worried that your new job might also go full in-office in the future. 

To reduce the risk of this happening again you can: 

1. Look for job listings that have flexible working options written in them somewhere, preferably in the benefits section, to indicate that remote work is a perk they offer and not just a temporary measure. 

2. Ask in the interview what their long-term plans are regarding remote work and how they determine which positions are in-office, hybrid, or fully remote. This will give you an idea of whether the company is receptive to flexible working arrangements and whether they have a clear policy regarding this.

3. Reasonably request in your offer letter that the position be kept hybrid or remote permanently and that they have a plan to accommodate this. 

4. Look for news articles or company reviews from employees talking about remote work policies, as this might indicate whether the company is serious about permanent flexible working options or if they are just using it as a perk to get people in the door.

Post Body: volunteering for local candidate and getting my first experience with the inner workings of political campaign one thing ve learned is that campaigns can get your info name address phone number etc from the registrar as part of that info we can also see if you requested mail ballot and whether you have voted yet obviously if the registrar shows that you have already voted there is no point in contacting you so you ll be removed from our lists if you haven voted yet or if you received mail ballot and haven sent it back you are prime target for cold calls from yours truly as well as canvassers knocking on your door sometimes folks tell me they are annoyed about getting so many political phone calls in ruder terms and it makes me want to shout just vote then so here am tldr vote as early as possible in every election to be removed from canvassing and phone banking lists speaking from the perspective of us elections and campaigns but assume it similar in other countries
Summary: If you don't vote or send back your mail-in ballot, political campaigns can use that information to contact you. If you do vote, they will remove you from their lists. So the moral of the story is to vote early to avoid political harassment.

Post Body: many dishwashers have the option of adjusting the height of the top rack where your cups and glasses typically go if you lower the top rack to make room for some tall glasses you might cause some wide plates in the bottom rack to block the upper spray arm the spinny thingy underneath the top rack which cleans your mugs and glasses from underneath place your tall glasses in the bottom rack raise the top rack and see if your dishwasher starts cleaning the cups and glasses more consistently edit and also clean the filter refill rinse aid and salt if applicable of course
Summary: To improve your dishwasher's performance, try adjusting the height of the top rack to make sure there is adequate space between racks for water to reach all dishes. These steps can help ensure dishes come out clean and clear after a cycle.

Post Body: just few hours at decibels or above can cause permanent hearing loss and tinnitus is something you don want for the rest of your life do yourself favor turn it down edit on iphone navigate to settings sounds haptics headphone safety turn on reduce loud sounds and set maximum volume to decibels on android it appears to only be available to samsung phones and the navigation may vary search for volume ymmv
Summary: Loud noise above 85dB can cause hearing damage. On iPhone you can navigate to Settings>Sounds>Haptics>Headphone Safety and turn on Reduce Loud Sounds, setting the maximum volume to 85dB. On Android, only Samsung phones have this setting, with the navigation varying somewhat.

Post Body: the awful truth is that there basically no way to pay them off without paying above the minimum but you have to trick yourself into doing it because throwing chunk of money at loan is even less satisfying than car repairs know that money stuff is really sensitive for people understand that everyone financial situation and loans are different and cannot account for all the variables or challenges you may have will not tell you to throw your tax refunds bonuses birthday money or other found money towards them will not tell you to change your lifestyle or spending habits in any way the secret lies in biweekly payments setup an auto billpay with your bank that pays half the monthly payment plus every two weeks on payday this will lessen the sting and surprise of each payment you ll sneak in an extra payment plus every year without noticing as you pay off the principal each payment will count little bit more please do not reply to tell me why this will not work for you because not saying it necessarily will saying it worked for me but if you can do it you ll knock off about in five years
Summary:
There is no magic trick to paying off your loans more quickly, but there are small things you can do to make a sizable impact over time. One of the best ways to pay your loans off faster is to set up an automatic payment with your bank account to pay half of your monthly payment every two weeks on payday. This way, you will make one full extra payment each year, which can cut down your repayment time by several years, and save you money on interest. 

Remember that everyone's financial situation is unique, and consulting a professional financial advisor is always a good idea.

Post Body: most refrigerators have legs that can be adjusted so the front is tilted slightly higher which allows the doors to close by themselves through the power of gravity unless of course there something physically blocking the door from closing most people do not seem to know this and never set it up after buying their fridge usually this is done by removing the front grille at the bottom of the fridge and turning screw bolt clockwise to raise the front and counter clockwise to lower the size of the screw bolt varies so you ll have to read the manual if you cannot identify what tool you need on your own
Summary: The front of your refrigerator can be tilted upwards by adjusting the legs at the bottom. This is important because it allows the door to close automatically without needing to be slammed shut. To adjust the legs, you'll need to remove the front grille at the bottom of the fridge and turn a screw bolt, either clockwise to raise the front or counterclockwise to lower it.

Post Body: planning ahead to do these things makes it breeze and helps ensure you are prepared for an emergency change the batteries in smoke and carbon monoxide detectors and test them few bucks for batteries and few minutes of your time will ensure that these devices are functioning properly even if the batteries are somewhat recent it saves middle of the night wakeup when the low battery beeping starts function all the water shut off valves in your home over time limescale and rust can build up on valves causing them to fail by operating them couple of times year it helps reduce failure it also helps you identify and repair failed valve before there is leak or an immediate need to shut it off start at each fixture and work my way to the main shutoff sub tip pawn shops and thrift stores are great places to find cheap wrench to keep alongside your main shutoff if it does require tool finally check tap and flip your fire extinguishers these vital safety devices do have lifespan and should be professionally serviced or replaced every years every manufacturer has their own recommendations when you are checking them for pressure and damage flip them upside down couple of times and give the bottom few firm taps with the heel of your hand over time the dry chemical in most household extinguishers can settle and cake at the bottom rendering them useless when you really need them agitation every months helps ensure they will be ready when you need them
Summary: Ensure your safety devices are in working order. Check the smoke and carbon monoxide detectors by changing the batteries and testing them. Operate all water shut-off valves to clear any possible lime scale or rust build-up. Check your fire extinguisher to ensure it is in good working order, following the manufacturer's recommendations.

Post Body: am was incredibly bad at making friends socially awkward and really introverted however my husband is social butterfly and loved by everyone and mean everyone he is loved not only at his company but at mine too swear only got invited to some things because their so husband and finally figured out it was all about how other directed we were tldr ask follow up questions everyone wants to feel validated to be seen heard and cared for to be seen as unique and as someone who is valued the best way to show people you feel that way towards them is to ask questions about them their life their opinions values and beliefs and remember their replies so when you meet people err on the side of asking more questions about said things than giving answers the conversation should focus on them but this should not be to the point where you are grilling them so if there is possible follow up question about something they said ask it it could be clarifying question or something as simple as oh how did you get into this sport when possible highlight similarities in interests or opinions totally agree the sports team will be hard pressed since so and so has an injury the main thing is to suppress your natural inclination to report about you and in all honestly you know your opinions why speak them out loud you learn nothing new by doing so only talk about you when they ask must say this can draw some toxic narcissistic people towards you who like to complain so be wary they don drag you down
Summary:
To become better at making friends, it is important to ask follow-up questions and engage in conversations about the other person. Ask questions about their life, opinions, values, and beliefs, and show them that you are listening by remembering what they say. Also, highlight similarities in opinions and interests. However, avoid talking about yourself too much, except when asked. This attracts narcissists, so be cautious of that. 

Did you know that people who ask questions are often perceived as more intelligent and interesting than those who don't? It's true! By asking questions, you can also learn more about the other person and develop a stronger connection with them.

Post Body: was performing at wedding last weekend and for what feels like the thousandth time in my career the big emotional speech of the evening was almost ruined because the bride father was holding the microphone by his stomach the attendees started to get fidgety couple of folks in the back yelled we cannot hear you and the sound engineer had to crank the gain the awful feedback sound we all know from the movies when someone gives the awkward speech at school assembly started happening and it got uncomfortable for second this can all be avoided if you hold the microphone close to your mouth just like every singer you ve ever seen does think of it like an ear belonging to an old person who has lost of their hearing you need to get close the easiest thing to remember imagine it an ice cream cone and you re about to lick it also most professional microphones do not have an on off switch so do not make the mistake of hunting for it the sound engineer should be monitoring the situation so you re covered just hold the mic close and start talking
Summary: At weddings, it is crucial to hold the microphone close to your mouth when giving a speech. Post Body: if you re like me you live in an area where mosquitos are an almost unbearable nuisance for most of the year but thankfully there very easy solution that has helped me tremendously in being able to enjoy my yard without being eaten up by the little blood sucking annoyances take bucket place handful of leaves in it fill it about of the way full with water and toss mosquito dunk in there or any similar product that uses bacteria to kill their larvae and set it up where you like to hang out at this combined with dumping out all standing water you can find around your property will drastically reduce the mosquito population around your yard since they lay their eggs in standing water you ve provided them perfect place to do so but it laced with bacteria that kills mosquito larvae it perfectly safe for humans pets and wildlife and these buckets will help with mosquitos for up to month before needing another dunk put in you may be able to get the job done just dumping out all the standing water but in some cases it just not enough and these bait buckets can be the final push in clearing them out after having mine out just few weeks can finally grill out without being pestered by mosquitos
Summary: To get rid of mosquitoes in your yard, you need to eliminate their breeding grounds. Pour standing water out of any containers and dump out any areas that collect standing water, such as kiddie pools. For persistent problems, use a bucket half-filled with leaves, then fill the rest of the way with water and add a mosquito dunk tablet, which kills the larvae. Place the bucket wherever you spend time outdoors.

Post Body: load back to front because dishes are heavy putting lot weight on the font of an extended dish rack without counter balance can cause damage to the tracks wheels unload bottom to top because dishes do not always drain perfectly unload the bottom rack dishes first to avoid dripping water that may have pooled on top rack dishes on to them run hot water through your sink before starting cycle because hot water cleans better unless you have some sort of instant hot water system you will know that it takes minute or two to get hot water from your tap the same is true for dishwashers running the sink first primes the pipes with hot water so when you start the dishwasher it will immediately fill with hot water otherwise the first cycle will be cold add soap to the pre wash because soap helps clean things not sure what need to say about this one soap cleans things that pre wash soap dispenser slot still exists for reason because adding soap makes big difference
Summary: To get the most out of your dishwasher and avoid possible damage, here are a few steps to follow when loading dishes. Firstly, it's best to load dishes back to front to balance the weight. Post Body: specific for usa but maybe useful elsewhere if you have occasion to get any kind of imaging done at hospital ray mri ct scan always sign whatever forms are needed to ensure that you can get your own copies of both the reports and images you have right to do so and should this is not to say you should not order them for your physician too just that you should always get copy for yourself this will save you lots of time and effort if when you want first second or third opinion from doctor that is not the original ordering doctor or if it is completed at hospital that is not affiliated with your particular practice images may not be faxed or sent through email at least here in ny so it can take up to days for them to mail it to your doctor of choice and it can be quite repetitive to fill this out over and over again so get your own copy while you re at it so you can at least save this time if you want other opinions and make clear to any doctor you hand your copy to that you expect it to be returned in the mean time you can order another copy for them but at least you have not delayed getting an opinion or treatment unnecessarily in addition if some condition comes up years down the road you now have good trackable evidence of prior issues that might be related medical records get harder to dig up the further back they are most states require medical offices to keep them between and years but you may find information in those records to be helpful much longer
Summary: Always ask for a copy of any MRI or CT scans you have done, along with the report. This is for your personal records and can save you time and effort if you ever need a second or third opinion from a doctor, or need to see a doctor outside of your usual practice. It also helps you maintain your own medical record, which can be useful if any issues arise later on.
