Post Body: may not apply to all but worth try changed my phone to iphone and started getting enormous amount of spam calls throughout the day usual was to only had one at most per day when was using android was really really desperate lot of the phone calls were from indians even signed up for paid removal service from databases which didn do anything and the spam filter app filtered too much my peculiar situation was that all of these calls seem to come from one or two call centers very similar indian accent in similar noisy environment so started telling them that whoever they are calling is dead immediately afterwards my spam call ratio dropped to once day so far so good for this past week will try to post follow up in month tldr for spam calls find out who they are calling tell them whoever just passed away and you are in mourning think this may work if you are getting called from single call center if you were getting called from different call centers it may not work but worth try

Post Body: someone cuts you off so you get angry someone doesn listen so you get frustrated sometimes we respond to things without acknowledging the space between an action and our reaction you always have choice recognizing this can give you emotional freedom direct quote from viktor frankl is between the stimulus and response there is space and in that space lies our freedom and power to choose our responses in our response lies our growth and our freedom
Summary: When someone does something that upsets you, you have the freedom to choose your response. Rather than simply reacting, taking a moment to assess the situation can help you grow and give you freedom. Viktor Frankl, a psychiatrist who survived Auschwitz, famously said that between a stimulus (what happens to us) and our response lies a space, and it is in that space that we can exercise our freedom to choose how we want to react.

Post Body: background worked as constituent service intern not so long ago and learned what we can actually do for the citizens in our area as it turns out there is lot some examples free septa pass for senior citizens above certain age that will allow folks to ride public tranportation or trains within the state for free get discount on out of state trains senior citizens who are low income can also get non profit job where your wage is payed for by the government and the work is part time if the government needs forum to provide services it is generally true that they are knowledgable and qualified to submit them for you and help you fill them out for instance during the covid lockdowns people needed to submit various forums for things like unemployment or medicare but the departments were under staffed and unable to help people so my state senators office helped people submit the forums more programs are avalible then you think and they may not have heard about all of them but generally they will be able to help in situations where other parts of the government cannot they can also answer your questions about the agenda of your state and whose doing what that is all part of their job last thing to note is some services require these people so they can be essential for instance the septa pass for seniors needs photo they will take that and fill out your information

Post Body: it may seem obvious but perhaps this is not general knowledge because as hotel worker this happens often guest will have problem with their room and will not mention it until they are leaving or long after they have left at that point it too late for us to do anything but if you mention it to the staff as soon as you discover problem we will probably be able to help you rectify it toiletries they needed extra bedding we can switch your busted hair dryer for new one we can get you replacement soap or more bedding even if it something more serious like housekeeper missed spot the ac unit is on the fritz or neighbor is blasting loud music we can often send someone to fix the issue get you moved to different room enforce quiet hours etc in an ideal world all hotel rooms would be perfect every time but unfortunately reality does not always go to plan people are human things break down and really the only way we know is if someone tells us the unruly children running up and down the th floor hallway may be keeping you up but cannot hear them from the desk on the ground floor lobby let us know the fact that your room iron died halfway through your stay is super frustrating get it but we are not telepathically linked to you or your room appliances let us know it really disheartening to staff to only hear about how horrible your stay was at check out when Summary: Guests often don't notify staff of problems with their hotel room until checkout, at which point it's too late for the hotel to fix the issue. Guests benefit from this as well, through compensation and a higher quality of stay.

Post Body: hi have lot of free time during travel using public transport want to use the free time to learn some technical things by watch or reading is there any tips to maximize this kind of learn think what am doing is only passive learning as will forget what learn later
Summary:
You want to use your time on public transport to learn new technical skills, but you're worried about passive learning and forgetting what you've learned. There is some advice below to help you maximize your learning potential in this situation. 

To improve your passive learning experience on public transportation, consider the following: 

1. Choose educational resources that are engaging and align with your interests to maximize your attention span. 

2. Take concise notes to solidify your understanding and create a tangible record of what you've learned. 

3. Review and summarize what you've learned to reinforce key concepts and improve retention. 

4. Apply the concepts in real life or through practice projects to cement your knowledge and develop practical skills. 

5. Stay consistent with your learning efforts to make the most of your available time and achieve lasting results. 

Remember, while passive learning has its limitations, it can still be a valuable tool for introducing new ideas and expanding your knowledge base. By combining passive learning with active learning techniques, you can make the most of your time on public transportation and maximize your learning potential.

Post Body: the best way to recieve compliment is genuine thank you nothing more nothing less it taken me long time to figure this out let say someone compliments your new haircut there are few says you could respond no way the barber totally messed it up and it probably looks kinda bad haha ve always hated my hair can never find good haircut thanks for trying to make me feel better about it though lol incredibly insecure makes the complimentor feel bad for even saying anything aw thanks love your hair too and that shirt is so cute your outfit looks great honestly your whole everything looks great you re so stunning comes off as very disingenuous complimentor will feel like you re only saying this back out of obligation to give them compliment as well oh yeah went to xyz salon they always do great job or trimmed about off and added some blonde highlights they did not ask where you got your hair done or what you did to it they just said they like it they most likely want to know that you appreciate the compliment and it made you feel all warm and fuzzy inside not just that you heard it best possible response thanks so much really appreciate the compliment and then make mental note to compliment them the next time you see them obviously does not apply to strangers this acknowledges that you appreciate the compliment and that it made you feel good without any unnecessary or awkward detail deflection or seemingly forced niceties basically train yourself to give em smile and genuine thanks so much nothing more nothing less of the time this will go over very well

Post Body: contradictions are just things that cannot both be true at the same time as soon as project contradicts itself it loses quality your project can have multiple objectives for example your room can be laid out to be good for movie watching and playing pool but if those are your objectives you should refrain from making decisions that makes the room worse at those two things combined whenever possible doing so should be last resort and it good for your project say you make decision that makes your room little worse for movies but lot better for pool that decision may make sense but if you make decision that makes your room slightly better for movies but lot worse for pool now you have net negative against your objective you say your objective is the best movie and pool room yet you just did something that does the opposite it contradiction
Summary: A project loses quality when it contradicts itself. Projects can have multiple objectives, but when making decisions about the project, it's important to consider how it will affect all of the objectives. Making a decision that favors one objective but negatively impacts another creates a net negative result. Projects should aim to avoid contradicting themselves at all costs.

Post Body: this happens because the gas needs oxygen to ignite but most stoves make you turn to high to start the igniter the amount of gas coming out of the burner surrounds the igniter with gas pushing any oxygen out of the igniter range blowing gently disrupts the gas flow enough to mix with air
Summary: If you experience a weak flame on your gas stove, gently blowing on the burner can help improve the flame. Blowing disrupts the flow of gas enough to mix with air and create the necessary oxygen for ignition. However, it is important to note that excessively blowing on the burner can result in a dangerous flame surge, so gentle ventilation is key. It is always better to identify the root issue causing the weak flame and resolve it accordingly.

Summary: If you want to improve your dog's reactive barking when it encounters other dogs, try to stay relaxed and friendly when you encounter non-aggressive dogs with their owners. Speak to both the owner and their dog in a happy tone, making compliments and telling the owner how great their dog is. This communicates to your dog that the situation is not a threat. Over time, this will improve your dog's reactions.  Don't forget to monitor your dog's behavior and step in if you see a conflict arising.

Post Body: just started the process to switch my carrier from verizon to another major carrier in order to port my phone number to the new carrier you have to request number transfer pin which acts as two factor authorization to move your number as soon as completely the request received text from verizon granting me off per line on my account for being loyal customer it last ditch attempt to keep customers from leaving and will save you mo per line for months if it works for you here how to request the number transfer pin pin is not the same as canceling or moving your line this is just the pin you need if you were going to move your line the pin itself expires after about week
Summary: If you want to switch carriers and take your phone number with you, you'll need to request a number transfer PIN from your current carrier (Verizon, in this case). This is a short-term PIN that expires after about a week, and it's used to authenticate and authorize number transfers between carriers. Keep in mind that requesting the PIN does not cancel or move your line; it simply allows you to take your number to a different carrier. If you're considering making a switch, check with your current carrier to see if they offer any discounts or incentives for loyal customers like Verizon's retention offer.

Post Body: most devices that are not powered by usb use round dc connector and regular power supply like older laptops speakers and all other kinds of electric devices usb pd supports different voltage some supports and if the usb supports or higher then it can give usb trigger cable contains chip that fakes the negotiating so the usb charger gives or turning it in to regular power supply for older devices for instance use it to power soldering iron with my powerbank and as replacement for lost powersupply for speaker its great solution for replacing lost broken power supply or making portable power supply using powerbank here is link to what they can look like have no opinion of these specific it is just as an example

Post Body: we all have bad days and good days but probably one of the single most important bits of mental health advice you can receive is the knowledge that while you do not have control over your bad days you do have control over your good days let your bad days be what they are you can be angry and sad and fully focused on what happened but do not let them effect your good days when they arrive because then you will never get to fully enjoy them it is extremely difficult to not let the bad bleed into the rest of your life to always be reliving the bad moments to be building upon those feelings and stewing in it but that the worst possible thing you can do learn to let go of those days because otherwise when all the stars align and everything is in your favor you are not going to be able to enjoy it and on all of the completely average days you re going to be steeped in that negativity from the bad days that you were not able to let go of and its going to taint all of those days and put you in downward spiral this sounds obvious and simple but it is far from easy to do and requires incredible emotional maturity but its simply the only way anyone is able to live life with peace or joy
Summary: Bad days happen to everyone, but it's important to not let them spoil the good days. While you might not be able to control the bad days, you do have control over how you respond to them and how long you let them affect you. Learn to let go of negative feelings from bad days to fully enjoy the good days and prevent the negativity from affecting your everyday life and emotional well-being. It's not easy, but it's necessary for peace and joy.

Post Body: one way got over dealing with hangovers was to include glass of plain water for every shot of liquor mixed drink beer would drink water in between sometimes you will even lessen drinking with this strategy but will have to pee all the time wah yes but the inconvenience of few extra trips to the toilet will heavily outweigh day long hell fest that is hangover pro tip it does not have to be full highball glass either lowball of will do but even introducing small amount between drinks will reduce the main cause of hangover which is severe dehydration if drinking lot keep glass and ask tip the bartender to keep the water full also quit drinking ages ago but saw another hangover post and thought this might help people awesome to do on dates too it shows you have some regard for yourself and also limits pounding drink after drink bc of bad nerves
Summary:
Drinking water in between alcoholic drinks can help prevent hangovers by keeping the dehydrated symptoms caused by alcohol consumption at bay. The trick works best when the water is sipped slowly, and it does not have to be a full glass each time. Plain water is best, but club soda or other soft drinks can also help. 

Though this can help alleviate hangovers, the best way to avoid them is to practice moderation when drinking and limit alcohol consumption overall.

Post Body: when moving to new place take the time to register your health information at the closest pharmacies and walk in clinics this proactive step can significantly reduce wait times and ensure you receive prompt medical attention during emergencies or unexpected health issues when moved to new city for work took the time to register my health information at the nearest pharmacy and walk in clinic few months later unexpectedly developed severe allergic reaction to something had eaten my face began to swell and was having difficulty breathing it was terrifying situation because had already registered at the nearby walk in clinic rushed there immediately instead of wasting time filling out paperwork or searching for suitable facility when arrived the staff already had my information on file including my known allergies this streamlined the check in process and they were able to administer the necessary treatment promptly thanks to the advance registration received prompt medical attention including antihistamines and epinephrine which helped alleviate the allergic reaction the whole experience was much less stressful than it could have been and credit it to taking the time to register my health information when first moved to the area it was lifesaver in critical moment
Summary:
If you move to a new city, be sure to register your health information at pharmacies and walk-in clinics.
This step can save you critical time receiving medical attention if an emergency happens.
Taking this step when I moved turned out to be lifesaving when I had a severe allergic reaction.

Post Body: every person has positive and negative qualities and was mainly focusing on the negative ones now wish to see the positive qualities too not just the obvious qualities like swimming for swimmer but the good qualities that make them special which are often hidden beneath the surface and communicate it do not want to flatter anyone just want to let them know that someone is watching and truly appreciates it please suggest related life pro tips lpts that you use in your personal life
Summary:
You want to focus on the positive qualities of people around you and express appreciation for these qualities that make them special, without flattering them. 

Some tips to do this include:

1. Pay attention: Take the time to genuinely observe and pay attention to people. Look for unique or admirable qualities they possess, especially those that might not be immediately obvious. 

2. Reflect on interactions: Think about your interactions with others and consider the positive impact they've had on you or others. This can help you identify specific qualities or actions you want to highlight.

3. Focus on growth: Instead of only praising achievements, you can also highlight how a person's efforts or specific traits have contributed to their success or growth. This shows that you recognize their potential and are supportive of their journey.

4. Specific compliments: Instead of a generic compliment, focus on specific actions or traits that you appreciate. This shows that you pay attention and have genuinely taken notice of their positive qualities. 

5. Personal growth: Taking the time to recognize and appreciate the positive qualities in others can also help you develop your own ability to be more aware and mindful of the people around you.

To ask for help, it is best to be clear and concise. Stick to the point, especially if you are messaging or emailing someone. Avoid making the person you are asking for help wait needlessly. Remember that communication is asynchronous, so be sure to convey all the necessary information to avoid frustration on either end. 

Compare being direct in your request, like "the printer is jammed again, can you take a look?" to being unnecessarily vague and leaving the recipient hanging, like "hey, can you help me with something?" or "what's up?" 

Be courteous, but also respect others' time by being efficient with your words and avoiding unnecessary small talk when you need help with something specific.

Post Body: my circadian rhythm is weird so that want to be up at night and feel most energetic and productive from pm to or am but then sleep in until noon or later whenever make myself go to bed earlier and get up earlier feel so lethargic all day despite getting good amount of rest because my body wants to be up later can drink caffeine but caffeine works too well for me and then cannot sleep interfering with my attempts to go to sleep earlier what can do to feel more energetic during the day
Summary:
You feel most productive at night, but during the day, you feel lethargic despite getting enough sleep. You also mention that caffeine affects your sleep, making it difficult to feel energized during the day. 

To feel more energetic during the day without depending on caffeine, it is crucial to address your sleep schedule and daily routines to align with your circadian rhythm. Here are some steps you can take:

1. Accept your natural rhythm: Instead of fighting against your body's natural tendency to be more awake at night, accept it and adjust your schedule accordingly. This may involve shifting your workday start time later, if possible, to align with your peak productivity hours.

2. Create a relaxing evening routine: Develop a wind-down routine to prepare your body and mind for sleep. This can include activities such as reading, stretching, listening to relaxing music, or taking a warm bath to help you feel calm and ready for sleep.

3. Practice good sleep hygiene: Ensure your bedroom is dark, quiet, and at a comfortable temperature. Avoid using your phone or other screen devices an hour before bed. Establish a consistent sleep and wake-up time, even on weekends. These habits promote better quality sleep.

Post Body: unlike most non latin scripts cyrillic is very similar to latin script shares about one third of characters with it and is very easy to learn to read it took me about three hours to learn it there are multiple websites where you can learn it even wikipedia will suffice script is used for example in bulgaria ukraine russia serbia and central asia slavic languages that use it generally pronounce every character always the same way no matter the position in word originally learned it because of one roadtrip to serbia bulgaria and it paid back many times after being able to read all the signs or reading food names in restaurant if you are not from europe these probably will not be your usual travel destinations but still would say it is cool to know another script might come in handy in some ethnic shops just note aside not all cyrillic characters are used in all cyrillic script languages and there are also regional variations in the character pronunciation also greek script is pretty similar to cyrillic and you can learn it as well while you are at it actually you will probably be able to read greek script after learning cyrillic script
Summary: Learning the Cyrillic script can be beneficial if you're interested in traveling to countries like Bulgaria, Ukraine, Russia, Serbia, or parts of Central Asia. BecauseCyrillic shares about a third of its characters with the Latin alphabet, it can be easy to learn, and doing so can help you navigate street signs, restaurant menus, and other written materials. Not all languages that use Cyrillic employ the same characters, and there can be variations in pronunciation, so if you're interested in a specific locale it could be helpful to focus your studies on the particular variant spoken there. Additionally, learning Cyrillic may make it easier to understand the Greek alphabet.

Post Body: if you re like me you ve probably had lots of arguments in your head whether it about conversations or interactions gone wrong or whether it worries about the future or past one way ve found to curb that nonsense is this imagine that you are in circle of fire whatever is outside of the fire are the things you can control accidents the way other people act unexpected events etc whatever is inside the circle are the things you can control the way you respond to stressors your day to day interactions your mindset etc now here is where the fire comes in because the fire is well hot there isn way for you to interact with meaning worry about the things you can control that also means that the things you can control can cross over the fire meaning you are not obligated to worry about them with all that in mind the only thing you can possibly do is to focus on what in the ring of fire the things you can control few disclaimers of course be sure you are clear on what you can control so you don either set yourself up with unrealistic expectations or fall into habit of passivity worrying is absolutely okay under certain contexts and should not be forcibly suppressed such as if you are in immediate danger of being hurt or killed or whatever other kind of life or death scenario or issues that could severely impact your lifestyle that being said it doesn do you any benefit to be worried over things that are less severe than these things this also isn an instantaneous thing that will immediately stop these thoughts it takes lot of practice to fully accept what you can vs what you can control hell it has taken me over year to realize these things anyways this is what works for me and hope it works for you but it completely fine if it doesn
Summary: Here is a strategy for dealing with worries and unwanted thoughts: visualize a circle of fire. Imagine that everything outside the circle is out of your control, including other people's actions and unforeseen events. Everything inside the circle, however, is within your control, such as your reactions to stressors, your interactions with others, and your daily mindset. Focusing on what's inside the circle can help you stop worrying about things you can't control. It's important to understand your abilities and limits and not worry excessively about things that aren't life-or-death matters. This approach takes time and practice to master, but it may be beneficial to you.

Post Body: in dc and in many states you can get speeding ticket in the mail from mounted camera along the highway that clocked your speed the camera operator name is listed on the ticket assume this is the person who monitors the camera calibration validates the accuracy of the ticketing is this officially the person or body issuing the ticket or how does this work exactly from legal perspective since it is not police officer found below excerpt from the department of transportation federal highway administration nhtsa speed enforcement operational guidelines field operations operator staffing and training unlike traditional traffic law enforcement mobile ase unit operators in most states do not have to be sworn police officers while some jurisdictions do require sworn police officers to conduct ase others use non sworn police employees other local government employees or employees of the equipment vendor traffic law enforcement officers have credibility with the public in terms of promoting the use of ase as tool for law enforcement they are also likely to have the best sense of the relationship between ase and other traffic law enforcement activities and are under direct police supervision vendor employees and other non police operators might be perceived as unqualified and might also lead to accusations of outsourcing police responsibilities operator conflict of interest and an emphasis on revenue generation
Summary: While many jurisdictions use regular police officers to conduct speed enforcement with mounted cameras, others use non-sworn police employees, local government employees, or employees of the camera vendor. Despite police officers having the best understanding of how these speed enforcement cameras fit into regular traffic enforcement, using them can lead to accusations of outsourcing police responsibilities or an emphasis on revenue generation.

Post Body: long story short my roomate bailed on me and ve had to find someone else to take over my lease as can afford it alone the new tenants have signed new year lease asked my landlord if there anything that needs to be signed to officially end my lease and he says it transfer of lease and once give them the keys done worst case if the new guys don pay is there any way my landlord can come back to me for money he also told me don get my deposit back since broke my lease would the text messages from this situation be enough to release me of any financial responsibility
Summary:
You can probably give your landlord textual proof that you've found new tenants to take over your lease, thus releasing you from your contractual obligations, but your landlord may still try to pursue you for costs or damages, especially if the new tenants don't hold up their end of the bargain. Depending on the laws of your state, your landlord may have to pursue you for a certain amount of time before they can legally move on to the new tenants, if that becomes necessary. 

As for the deposit, your landlord is correct that you breached your lease by moving out early, and they can likely use that deposit to cover any costs related to finding new tenants or making the apartment ready for new tenants. Again, depending on your local laws, they might be required to itemize those costs for you. However, they can't simply keep the deposit in full arbitrarily. 

Make sure to follow up with your landlord in writing to confirm that you're released from your lease and that they won't come after you for any further costs or damages. Keep a copy of that written confirmation for your records.

Post Body: hello to all phd candidate at one of the central premier government institution in india recently we got an email from one of our dean at the institute containing list of guest houses available to book in dehradun for conference about to take place this was because we can not reimburse stay in any private hotel outside new rule so today we looked at the list of places available and called to book one of them using the contact number provided in the list given to us the person on the other side spoke as guest house official and explained us the rooms available and the charges we proceeded to book the ones as per our need he asked for the ids and advance for the stay this didn seem alarming and we sent an amount of via upi which is lot for us as we re students now he was supposed to send us the receipt for the same and said that he ll do so he didn do that and kept giving one or the other excuse that he ll soon do now he blocked my number as was repeatedly calling him and it clear that it fraud don know how to proceed with what has happened we re planning to meet the dean tomorrow but we know that dean will not take any responsibility from the administrators behaviour at the institute as he sent us the list with the contact of fraudster he should bear some responsibility if not all can we students battle with the dean legally if so how to go about it if you wanna know any details do ask except for my institution name

They never sent you a receipt for the transaction and blocked your number after you requested it several times. 3. Contact the institution's fraud department or security team to report the incident. They may be able to help you recover the lost money and identify the scammer. 
4. Spread awareness about this incident to other students at your institution to prevent similar occurrences in the future. 

5. Review your finances and credit score to ensure that there has not been any malicious activity besides this incident.

You have no written confirmation of your work for them, but you sign project contracts via Docusign and are the face of the company with their clients.

Here are some key points to consider: 

1. Documentation: It's important to have documentation of your work, especially when it comes to payment terms and deadlines. While you may not have a traditional contract, any emails, texts, or other written communications discussing payment can serve as evidence in your favor if you were to take legal action. 

2. Payment History: Consider how long this client has been paying you late and whether they have a history of being financially stable. If this is an unusual situation for a client who has generally been reliable, there may be a reasonable explanation for their delay. 

3. Communication: It's important to maintain open lines of communication with your client.

Post Body: hi was hoping someone could offer advice my partner myself and our six month old son are currently living in house that we have inherited from my parents we originally moved in with my father to look after him after my mother passed away with the intention of eventually buying the house but unfortunately my father lived less than year and we have not had the time to save what we needed too anyway in this time neighbour has put in an insurance claim as they have some subsidence to their property after an inspection it was deemed that large cherry tree and some shrubbery in our garden could have contributed to it and they should be removed we agreed to this work being done back in april this year on the condition that the area where the trees were to be removed would be levelled out and and turfed as otherwise there would be large drop down at the back of our garden and also that it happened over the summer as we intended to put the house up for sale in the winter this was agreed to by the mitigation service working on behalf of the insurer we told the neighbours about this and they said they were going to put up fence we advised them to either wait until the work had been complete or build wall brining that part of the garden level with the rest before putting the fence up my wife who teaches civil engineering also drew them some plans of what was needed they ignored this and whilst we were out of the country visiting family put up fence without the retaining wall so we eventually got date for the work to happen and it happened last week th november lot later than we had hoped the contractors doing the work came and removed the trees then spoke to me about the plans for levelling the garden the next day which were not levelling the garden as agreed but merely compacting the soil and laying some turf on top at this point we went back to the mitigation company and told them they made some calls and came back to us telling us the work that we had agreed to would be carried out we had sent photographs in the exchange and informed them that the ground needed to be raised around ft the next morning the contractors arrived and told us that that is not what they were told to do so they made some calls and eventually ended up coming up with plan for the work that needed to be done passing quote to the insurer and leaving we have no contact with and do not know who the insurer is called the mitigator who said the contractors had agreed to do the work eventually they accepted that it was not what had been agreed they now have the quote and are meant to be passing it on to the insurers as of my last contact this morning they have not done this believe the contractors had passed the quote and plan for the work onto the insurer as they had no idea who the mitigation company was now all of this is preventing us from putting the house on the market and causing fair bit of distress if we had been staying in the house we may not have agreed to the work as the tree held sentimental value although we feel it would have been unfair on our neighbours to deny the work we need the work doing as soon as possible but the insurer and mitigator seem to move at snails pace do have any legal case for breach of contract or for undue stress or anything cannot imagine the insurer will refuse the re quoted work but it may take them another months to do anything about it really just want to force their hand into getting it sorted as quickly as possible
Summary:
You agreed to remove trees and shrubs on your property to mitigate subsidence to a neighbouring property. The removal was agreed to on the condition that the garden was levelled and turfed. Your neighbours erected a fence without retaining walls before the work was done, preventing the garden from being levelled as agreed. The gardening work was done to a substandard level and you are now pursuing the insurer to have the garden levelled as agreed. 
You are seeking advice on whether you have a legal case against your neighbours or the insurer.

Post Body: im thinking about starting podcast where simply read reddit stories now the issue with it is some stories are so old that its sometimes by deleted user or people simply dont respond so my question is can just simply pickup stories from reddit off the bat and read post them without the op permission would get in some form of legal trouble for it and would it be advisable to credit their username while reading stories or should leave it out
Summary:
You can read stories from Reddit on your podcast without prior permission from the original poster (OP) but there are certain legal risks involved and there are steps you can take to minimize these.

It is advised to credit the original OP to avoid plagiarism and copyright issues. However, since Reddit usernames are not unique, you might consider citing the source URL to give proper credit. 

To further minimize legal risks, ensure you do not read stories that might infringe on copyright, defame someone, or invade privacy. Also, avoid using any personal information about the OP or other users that might identify them indirectly (e.g., their job, location, or other unique details). 

It is also good practice to reach out to the OP if you plan to read a story they posted, not only to ask for permission but also to give them a chance to opt-out if they wish to. This can serve as a waiver of sorts should they change their mind later. 

Lastly, having a good understanding of applicable laws and copyright regulations in your jurisdiction is essential to navigate these risks properly. 

Note that this is general advice and not specific to any law or jurisdiction. For precise answers, please consult a legal professional.

Post Body: just so clear do not want to use the actual music itself to be playing with my web comic however do want to imply that there music playing in the background of scene by writing down the song lyrics of course would put an author note crediting the artist and name of song if were to do that would have to pay for some sort of license to do so
Summary:
You would need to obtain a license from the music copyright holder, crediting the artist and song is not enough on its own. 

Sync licenses (also known as synchronization licenses) are necessary whenever music is paired with visual media, such as in a YouTube video, a movie, or a podcast. 

A sync license grants the rights to use a musical composition synchronized with visual media. Even if you don't plan on using the music itself, obtaining a sync license is usually necessary for lyrical works. 

It's important to note that the process of obtaining a sync license can vary depending on the music and the copyright holder, it might be best to consult a legal professional or the copyright holder directly to ensure that you obtain the necessary license to use the music lyrics in your web comic.

Post Body: will receive an acd for misdemeanor charge it was the first time was ever involved with law enforcement ve been really worried about it despite my lawyer telling me it the best possible outcome wouldn an outright dismissal be the better outcome ve heard that having the acd open for months means that the public can still view the pending charges against me ve also heard that third party background check websites can get access to the information in this timeframe and then will obviously not be under the jurisdiction of the sealing after the adjournment period meaning my information could still be public through these sites is that something should be worried about also how likely is it that the dismissed sealed charges will affect me in the future will never be trusted again because was arrested know limited agencies can view the record after the sealing but even then if get pulled over for ticket in the future will the police officer ticketing me be able to see my sealed arrest and does simply having an arrest without conviction on my record bar me from getting certain jobs like in education or counseling was kind of considering doing do one day but now wondering why they ever let someone be teacher or therapist if they were arrested can someone please put my mind at ease everyone keeps telling me an acd is great outcome but knowing there will always be record of my arrest held against me is really upsetting
Summary:
You are worried that although you will receive an ACD (adjournment in contemplation of dismissal) for a misdemeanor charge, which your lawyer views as the best possible outcome, you are concerned that this will still affect your future employment prospects and be a permanent black mark against you. 

You are particularly concerned that the charge will still be visible to third parties through background checks, and wonder if this is something you should be worried about, and whether a dismissal would be a better outcome. 

You would like reassurance that an ACD outcome will not negatively affect your life indefinitely moving forward. 

An ACD is a favorable outcome compared to a conviction, and while it does not entirely erase the event of your arrest, it is not considered a conviction and will not show up on most background checks for employment purposes. 

However, it is true that certain government agencies and positions, especially those in the education field, may request information about your arrest record pursuant to the California Education Code. 

Because an ACD is not a conviction, you should be prepared to explain the circumstances surrounding your arrest in order to best advocate for yourself.

Post Body: hi all venturing into the bike business in australia planning to import from chinese manufacturer and add our own branding we ve hit roadblock though finding liability insurance is proving to be quite challenging we have noticed that other retailors seem to hand off liability via the terms and conditions the liability section here seems to palm off all responsibility to the manufacturer is transferring liability to the manufacturer feasible strategy for us or would be still be held liable if something went wrong and person was injured on the bike do these other companies just work without it any insights or experiences you can share would be greatly appreciated also planning to seek legal advice but first hand experiences or knowledge would be incredibly helpful thanks in advance
Summary:
You can't just pass on liability to the manufacturer in your terms and conditions. That will probably not hold up in court if someone gets hurt and decides to sue you. Other companies probably have liability insurance, or are operating in countries with less stringent liability laws, or are taking the risk of operating without insurance. You should definitely seek legal advice, perhaps from a lawyer who specializes in liability law.  It may be possible to structure your business in such a way as to limit your liability, for example by forming a legal entity such as a corporation, but you would need expert advice on the specific steps you could take. 
Obviously, riding bicycles involves some risk, and you may have to weigh the risks and costs of liability insurance vs. the cost of product improvements that would make your bicycles safer, or the cost of saving a few dollars by not offering insurance or legal protections to your customers. 

Let me know if you have any other questions about starting your bike business!

Post Body: would it be considered conflict of interest for lawyer to be one of three hoa board member who has then interpreted the rules and regulations of the hoa and set special assessment that would benefit their unit at what point does it become point of conflict of interest if it is not already
Summary: As a lawyer, you must avoid conflicts of interest in your professional and personal life. When you have a financial interest in an outcome that may be affected by your legal work, you have a conflict of interest. To avoid this, you must resign from the HOA board and recuse yourself from any decisions relating to that board and your property.

Post Body: what is the difference in consequences between getting mph ticket and mph ticket do need lawyer for going mph what are my options also have point on my license currently doubt that helps much any helpful advice would be greatly apperciated please and thank you
Summary:
You were going 20 MPH over the speed limit, you have a point on your license already, and you're wondering if you need a lawyer and what your options are. 

I cannot give legal advice, but in general, here are a few things to keep in mind. 

1. The consequences of a ticket vary from state to state and are often determined by the driver's history of violations. In some states, a driver may be able to attend traffic school to have the ticket removed from their record and avoid points on their license. 

2. Tickets for higher speeds may result in more severe penalties, such as a higher fine or a longer period of license suspension. In some cases, a driver may be required to appear in court for a high-speed ticket, even if they have a lawyer. 

3. Having a lawyer may be advantageous in situations where the driver is seeking to reduce the severity of the penalties or have the ticket dismissed. Lawyers can assist in gathering evidence, negotiating with the prosecution, and building a defense strategy. 

4. You may be able to contact the DMV and inquire about your options for reducing points on your license. This may include taking a defensive driving course.

A legal team based in Ontario would likely have a stronger understanding of the local laws and regulations, as well as the local court processes which could be beneficial in fighting your speeding ticket.

Ultimately, the choice of legal counsel is up to you and you should choose a lawyer or team that you feel confident will represent your interests effectively.

Post Body: this is in quebec bought house deed of sale was signed last week seller is renting from us until dec when we get the keys they re paying us for the the first weeks of mortgage accordingly there is no regie du lodgement lease agreement signed the dryer stopped working and seller is expecting us to repair or replace the appliance quebec promise to purchase contains the following standard language if the seller vacates the immovable before december he shall nevertheless remain responsible unless otherwise stipulated in clause for keeping the immovable in the condition that it was in when the buyer visited it if the occupancy of the premises is to be subsequent to the signing of the deed of sale heating electricity and general maintenance costs relating to the premises occupied shall be assumed by the seller included in the sale are the following items dryer which are sold without any legal warranty of quality at the buyer own risk but must be in working order at the time of delivery of the immovable does time of delivery mean the signing of the deed of sale or the hand over of keys the seller needs to either repair the appliance replace with like or offer us cash equivalent to the cost of the same dryer of the same age correct
Summary: In the deed of sale for a house in Quebec, it is stated that the seller is responsible for the dryer appliance that is included in the sale, as long as it is in working order at the time of key delivery. Since the dryer is not working, the seller must repair it, replace it with one of the same age and condition, or offer financial compensation to the buyer.

Post Body: ve been an hr professional for almost years and recently joined new company they say that an offer letter is legal document and because of that legal has the right to dictate everything in the offer letter and must sign off in my previous years of experience hr would dictate the offer letters and if any one off situations came up we would consult with legal to get their advice and then we would decide how best to use this verbiage any time push back on legal like the un friendly verbiage to the offer letter the paragraphs of information vs bullet points etc they say it is legal document so stop asking to change it helpful to note we have new hires sign confidentiality agreements that contains non compete clauses this is legal document can legal attorney with experience in employment law tell me if an offer letter that contains an at will statement visibly present is indeed legal document or am right in that it is not legal document since they make no promises of future employment
Summary:
You are correct that offer letters are not legal documents in and of themselves. Offer letters are more of a formality and reflect the terms of employment a company would like to extend to a candidate. They are not binding contracts and can't be used in court to enforce promises of employment. 

However, certain clauses in offer letters can create legal issues if not handled properly. For example, at-will statements and non-compete agreements can be included in offer letters, but they must be written clearly and concisely to be enforceable. It's always a good idea to have an attorney review offer letters to ensure compliance with relevant employment laws and to mitigate risk. 

It is also worth noting that the nature of the offered role and its responsibilities may also determine the necessary legal precautions your offer letter should include, so consult an attorney near you for specific advice.

Summary:
You recently quit your job and gave your two-week notice. Your former employer reimbursed you for licensing exams required for your job several months ago. Upon termination of your employment, your employer reminded you about a handbook clause that states you must repay the exam reimbursement if you leave within a certain time frame. They also informed you that your final paycheck will be deducted to settle this debt. You're aware of the policy but want to know if this type of policy is legal. 

It is entirely legal for employers to include a repayment clause for exam reimbursements in an employee handbook or employment contract, and many companies do. Whether or not deductions from your final paycheck to recoup the expense of your exam reimbursement is permissible depends on the state you live in and the circumstances of your departure. 

States vary in their legislation of this practice. Some states, like California, prohibit employers from making deductions from final paychecks altogether. Others might allow deductions but could have laws regarding how much an employer can deduct or specify that deductions must be voluntary. 

If you're unsure if your state permits this type of deduction, consult with an attorney or tax professional for guidance specific to your location.

Post Body: how is this different than bankruptcy proceeding assignee vs trustee obviously there no bankruptcy discharge what the strategy behind using this legal device would it be normal for creditors to actually have their attorneys file notices of appearances in addition to filing proof of claim
Summary: A bankruptcy trustee and assignee both play roles in administering a bankruptcy estate. The trustee is appointed by the court and responsible for managing the estate, protecting assets, and distributing funds to creditors. An assignee is appointed by creditors and has more limited powers, primarily focused on realizing the assets of the debtor for the benefit of creditors. Creditors typically hire attorneys to file notices of appearance and proof of claim to ensure their rights are protected and to maximize their recovery from the bankruptcy estate. The use of an assignee instead of a trustee is less common and may be driven by specific legal or strategic considerations.

Summary: You need a mechanical license if you want to record a song and release it publicly, a synch license to post it on YouTube, and a master license if you use the original recording as a backing track. Summary:
You and your husband have been caring for your nephew since his birth parents passed away. His grandfather, who is his legal guardian, has recently stopped sending him to visit you and is now refusing to return him to your care. You're concerned he will try to adopt your nephew, cutting you out of his life. You've filed for emergency guardianship which will be heard in a few days. 

It would be difficult to provide any confident assessment of your chances of successfully gaining emergency guardianship without knowing more about the specific laws and procedures in your state. 

It will be important to demonstrate to the court that you and your husband have been acting as de facto parents to your nephew for a significant period of time and that your nephew is thriving in your care. Post Body: was having conversation with some friends obviously apocalypse movies and tv shows came up after we memed on lou do not care about the controversy over joel etc but we were discussing how abby and joel but should not exist in an apocalypse scenario where would you get the proteins and workout stuff to get that fit where do you get your protein shakes in an apocalypse scenario most groceries and modern diet staples would not be thing imo movie wise feel like resident evil movies are bad at it look at mila she has this pristine makeup face where do you fine time to apply eyeliner or where do you find eyeliner and the food to keep up that physique
Summary: In apocalyptic movies and TV shows, characters like Abby and Joel from The Last of Us frequently have exceptional physiques that would require a substantial amount of protein and other nutrients to maintain. However, in a post-apocalyptic world, many grocery stores and modern dietary staples would likely not be accessible. This presents a challenge for survivalist fiction to realistically depict characters' fitness and nutrition. Additionally, characters in these movies are often shown with elaborate makeup and clothing, which would be difficult to find the time and resources to maintain in a chaotic and resource-scarce environment. Resident Evil is criticized for this because of Mila's well-maintained appearance.

It seems that there is a lack of innovation in terms of storytelling in contemporary cinema. Recent films seem to follow tried and tested formulas and structures, with fewer experiments with narrative form. Although there are more films being made now than ever before, it appears that there is little room for risky or experimental filmmaking. However, there are still some examples of innovative films, such as those by directors like Jordan Peele and Charlie Kaufman. The independent cinema scene, which has traditionally been a haven for experimental filmmaking, seems to have lost its edge in this regard. 
The narrator is wondering if they are just not looking in the right places for innovative modern films or if there is a genuine lack of creative risk-taking in contemporary cinema.

You should watch Rashomon (1950) next, as it is another masterpiece by Kurosawa and one of the most influential films in the history of cinema. Despite having a high success rate, Kurosawa did direct some films that are not as highly regarded. 

Some other must-watch films by Kurosawa include:

1. Ikiru (1952): About a man struggling with mortality and the meaning of life. 
2. High and Low (1963): A powerful drama that explores social differences and the impact of a kidnapping. 
3. Throne of Blood (1957): A reimagining of Shakespeare's Macbeth set in feudal Japan. 
4. The Hidden Fortress (1958): A classic samurai adventure featuring memorable characters and clever storytelling. 
5. Ran (1985): A dramatic tale of betrayal and war, inspired by King Lear. 

Remember, while these films are highly regarded for their directorial vision, storyline, and technical achievements, personal preferences may vary.

Post Body: christmas carol is one of my favourite stories ever told it seems year after year the same handful of adaptations gets mentioned as the best muppets george scott alastair sim bill murray this one is my second favourite but never see the musical adaptation with albert finney mentioned it my personal favourite retelling of the story it lavishly filmed gothic shockingly dark legitimately creepy adaptation even when it does the musical thing and breaks into song and dance it seems so earned that it just fits within the atmosphere of the production and some of those numbers are downright catchy then there albert finney this dude was when he played scrooge in this shout out to the make up department because you legit would never believe that man in is mid honestly unbelievable makeup and performance he looks sounds acts like an old crotchety man should ve got some kind of awards consideration also just the atmosphere feels so chilly like you re just wanting to get home and feel warm again on winter night the production design is just incredible think this adaptation really remembers that christmas carol is ghost story above all which many of the adaptations seem to miss mostly slightly but it makes huge difference christmas carol is creepy and brooding and this adaptation gets to those feelings the best
Summary: The Albert Finney musical adaptation of "A Christmas Carol" is underrated and deserves mention alongside the likes of "The Muppets," "George Scott," and "Alastair Sim" versions of the story.  It is dark and brooding with incredible production design and musical numbers, enhanced by Albert Finney's incredible makeup and performance as Scrooge.  This adaptation remembers that Christmas Carol is ultimately a ghost story and taps into that effectively.

Post Body: to begin with ve always been fascinated by dreams and surrealism ve always loved donnie darko and david lynch films so did not mind the ambiguous narrative at all as far as the execution goes can honestly say that loved how real it all felt the guerilla film making and the presence of real companies made the whole thing very grounded in our reality which made the surreal stuff more believable may be alone in this but seeing someone plugged into strange machines and experimented on by an android becomes another level of bizarre when the machines have giant siemens logo on them and when the lab is inside real location in disneyland ve noticed this too with haruki murakami books murakami likes to reference brands in his stories saying things like he pulled out marlboro he ordered perrier and we drove past mcdonalds not sure what his personal reason for doing it is but for me it creates sense that the protagonist inhabits the same universe that do probably because referencing brands is rare in fiction legal troubles probably it feels more like the memoirs of real person did not think roy abramsohn acting was bad he looked genuinely distressed when he lost sarah some people point to few grimaces he made in the beginning of the film but personally found them funny in campy leon kennedy sort of way the whole theme of sexual frustration reminded me of silent hill as strange as that comparison may be liked some small cheesy details like the fact that when jim was electrocuted in the crotch you could see his pelvis and femur bones in cartoonish disney like fashion also liked how small bits of lore re emerge later like the cat flu tbh missed it before looked up some video essays can see how it not everyone cup of tea but overall thought it was an interesting little project

They especially enjoy the guerilla filmmaking and the inclusion of real-world logos and locations, like Siemens and Disneyland, which add to the film's bizarre tone. The narrator also appreciates the acting of Roy Abramsohn and the film's themes of sexual frustration. They also enjoy small details like the cartoonish depiction of bones when Jim is electrocuted. Overall, the narrator finds 'Brazil' to be an interesting and unique project.

Summary:
Some of my favorite fights from movies are:

1. The battle of Helm's Deep from The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers: This epic battle features a fortress defense, heroic sacrifices, and a decisive victory for the good guys. 
2. The final battle in The Matrix: Revolutions: A massive fight involving helicopters, kung fu, and lots of explosions. Love the philosophical underpinnings and the tension between Neo and Smith. 
3. The Darth Vader vs. Luke Skywalker duel in Star Wars: Return of the Jedi: A classic good vs. evil battle, with the fate of the galaxy hanging in the balance. 
4. The "NoHoldsBarred" fight in Rocky III: A hilarious and over-the-top boxing match that showcases Rocky's determination and spirit. Love the message about staying true to yourself. 
5. The "Battle of NY" in Marvel's The Avengers: A massive, city-destroying clash between the Avengers and Loki's alien army. Love the teamwork and chaos. 
Remember, these are just my personal favorites, and everyone has their own opinions on what makes a great movie fight scene.

Summary:
You should check out some of these comedians and films if you're looking for alternatives to Saturday Night Live alumni like Will Farrell, Adam Sandler, and Ben Stiller, and enjoy sharp, witty comedy more than satirical slapstick:

1. Richard Pryor: A hugely influential stand-up comedian who transitioned to film, known for his frank and observational style. Films like "Blazing Saddles," "The Jerk," and "Blue Collar" showcase his talent.

2. Woody Allen: A master of cerebral, dialogue-driven comedies. His extensive filmography includes "Annie Hall," "Hannah and Her Sisters," and "Manhattan."

3. Christopher Guest: Known for his mockumentary style, Guest and his regular collaborators, including Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, and Fred Willard, offer satirical depictions of everyday characters in films like "Best in Show," "This Is Spinal Tap," and "Waiting for Guffman."

4. Mel Brooks: A pioneer of parody and satire. His films, including "The Producers," "Blazing Saddles," and "Young Frankenstein," offer hilarious takes on classic film tropes and genres.

Post Body: the silent world is ocean documentary made by legendary documentarian jacques cousteau like many of cousteau film this film focuses primarily on the ocean the film is noteworthy for being one of the first movies that featured underwater cinematography to be shot in color resulting in some truly beautiful imagery in fact to this day the film is still considered one of the most visually beautiful documentaries ever made however nowadays in addition to it pretty imagery the film is also known for another reason the shocking amount of cruelty displayed to the marine life of course there the infamous scene where cousteau blows up coral reef to get fish samples something that he even acknowledges is wrong in the movie however there is also the scene where he rides turtle and makes it very difficult for the turtle to surface for air and then there the scene where whale is severely harmed in an attempt to attract sharks and then killing the sharks who responded to it as an animal lover these scenes are pretty hard to watch it like the cove before the cove was thing even cousteau himself would come to regret the decisions he made in the movie he would go onto become vocal advocate for ocean conservation and would express regret for the things he did although the film is still recognized for it significance to film and for being visually striking the film is still considered extremely hard to watch due to it cruelty to the point where it actually was featured in an earlier post made about critically acclaimed movies that are hated now
Summary:
'The Silent World' is a beautiful yet difficult to watch documentary about the ocean. It is aesthetically striking due to its underwater cinematography in colors. Nevertheless, it is notorious for the cruel treatment of marine life for film purposes, which included blowing up a coral reef and harming turtles and whales. Following the release of the documentary, its director Jacques Cousteau became an advocate for ocean conservation. 
Despite its historical significance, the documentary is still hard to watch because of the cruelty toward animals displayed in it.

Post Body: will start with minor moment at the beginning of the greatest christmas movie of all time diehard before the opening credits are done holly genero mcclain calls her nanny to see if john bruce willis has called the house he has not she is obviously upset with the state of their relationship she slams photo of their entire family down this moment blocks the fact that she is married and that john may have something that hans gruber and company could exploit this gives john enough time to attack their plans enough that he can ultimately survive

Post Body: the term computer generated imagery cgi is bit misleading fostering the misconception that computer autonomously generates results in reality cgi is meticulously artistic process created by people basic explanation of cgi cgi is akin to sculpting with digital clay in software followed by texturing and animating the asset before heading off to post production for final touches the inconsistency in cgi quality regardless of the year its made stems from myriad of factors including last minute alterations by studio executives unclear visions time constraints for artists and varying skill levels it also worth mentioning not all cgi aims for hyper realism for the curious full workflow breakdown could look something like gathering references sculpting both low and high poly models unwrapping and organizing the low poly model exporting as fbx files importing into texturing software baking details texturing exporting textures creating material node groups applying textures to the model painting weights creating rig naming the bones and joints assigning control mechanisms blocking out keyframes and finally refining motions while tools like mocap scans and photogrammetry aid cetain aspects they represent just fraction of the pie
Summary: The term "computer-generated imagery" (CGI) can be misleading, as it suggests that the process is entirely automated, when in fact it is a very manual and artistic process. CGI involves creating 3D assets, texturing them, and bringing them to life through animation and movement, before adding finishing touches in post-production. The varying quality of CGI, despite advancements in technology, can be attributed to human factors such as studio interference, time constraints, and different levels of artist skill. Not all CGI aims for hyper realism, and technological aids like MOCAP and photogrammetry only contribute to part of the process.

france and japan it will not be enough to outweigh the total rejection from basically every other country on earth not helping is the critical thrashing it received and harsh wom from audiences who ve dismissed it as soulless bit of corporate dreck here the thing about wish that makes it different from our other case studies though this shit was meant to be massive like cultural phenomenon big granted encanto did become that but it was not positioned to be that way from the start like wish is they likely expected modest performance and one or two popular songs for that film along the lines of moana wish however is the th anniversary film the one that meant to tie together the canon under one unifying tale disney has spared no expense with the marketing and has deployed reams of merchandise of every kind into shops across the globe so confident were they of its potential that they released pre prepared global phenomenon video assuming it would be hit that is so divorced from and put this thing on streaming where it ll undoubtedly get more eyes on it and merch selling or do they stay the course and wait few months the argument against this of course is that audiences have been trained to wait for disney movies on the platform each christmas hence ruining ticket sales but argue that damage has already been done and short of removing disney from the market entirely it going untapped what everyone thoughts on this and on the likelihood they ll bring wish to streaming before the th
Summary: For the past three years, Disney has made a habit of dropping its Thanksgiving release directly onto Disney+ in time for the holidays. This tactic has paid off for some of their films, such as Encanto, which is now considered a modern classic despite its middling box office performance. However, Disney's latest release, Wish, has not been as successful. The film was expected to tie together the canon of Disney films under one unifying tale, but it has not been well-received critically or financially. Disney is now at a crossroads, deciding whether to put the film on Disney+ or wait a few months. There are arguments for and against this decision, as well as concerns about the potential profits from merchandise related to the film.

to offset storyline made up of various sci fi fantasy tropes metacritic reviews reviews variety who shot the film himself stages it on an impressively lavish scale all the cgi sprawl budget of million can buy and handful of the episodes are fun like one where the noble hunk tarak staz nair frees himself from indentured servitude by harnassing giant blackbird who like ray harryhausen creature sofia be for snyder cultists only slashfilm by the end of rebel moon the closing title card of end part one feels more like threat than promise hollywood reporter never met superhero team roundup he didn love and although he put aside capes and spandex for rugged galactic garb the screenplay he co wrote with kurt johnstad and shay hatten plays like the result of someone feeding seven samurai and star wars into ai scriptwriting software deadline moon is film that struggles to find its own voice amidst litany of borrowed themes and styles while visually impressive it lacks the coherence and character depth needed to elevate it beyond mere pastiche of its influences snyder fans might find elements to appreciate but for those seeking fresh and engaging sci fi adventure this film may not hit the mark then again this is part one so maybe part two will give the narrative room to breathe the wrap moon part child of fire isn complete film the story will continue and presumably conclude in the next installment so perhaps some of this movie issues will be addressed later on and part will improve with the benefit of hindsight or perhaps it will look worse after the follow up comes out which is equally plausible until then it is simply what it is and that is hugely expensive but uninspired star wars knockoff with some thrilling action sequences and some truly ugly moments that taint the entire thing screenrant with rebel moon snyder is positively bursting with exciting ideas but they lack compelling characters and solid plot to hold them up ign despite great ensemble cast zack snyder space opera is let down by derivative patchwork script mediocre action sequences and superficial story that fails to live up to its expansive promise indiewire assume that we ll learn little bit more about djimon hounsou drunken tactical genius when the imperium descends upon the veldt in the second part of rebel moon and that anthony hopkins robot will explain why it wearing pair of antlers in the last shots but it also possible these unanswered questions are merely pretext for another snyder cut one that netflix can use to squeeze few more view hours out of movie so insufferable that it should be measured in milliseconds whatever the case it hard to be even morbidly curious let alone excited about any future iterations or installments of franchise so determined to remix million things you ve seen before into one thing you ll wish you never seen at all total film zack snyder never does anything by halves but even by his standards the first part of his long gestating space saga is thunderous portentous gargantuan slab of mythological sci fi fantasy the independent the justice league director cut filmmaker has made his own version of star wars movie only filled with motivational speeches sexual violence and charlie hunnam stumbling his way through soon to be infamous irish accent bbc nothing exciting happens there are no challenges to meet no obstacles to overcome no death stars to destroy despite the grandiosity of the film bombastic tone the story turns out to be disappointingly minor presumably because snyder main aim was to introduce the cast and to set the scene for rebel moon part two the scargiver which is due next year part one itself ends up feeling bit pointless inverse moon may come off as blitz of interesting ideas that have yet to be fleshed out in earnest it doesn help that child of fire ends on cliffhanger of sorts effectively demanding follow up the optimists among us and yes the snyder bros too may read this first installment as an overture its many loose threads more like breadcrumb trail for future installments to circle back to it ironic to expect more from director that already synonymous with maximalism beneath all its spectacle though the rebel moon universe could do with bit more context polygon bummer to have to dunk so hard on brand new piece of fantasy nerddom delivered just in time for the holidays but try as he might snyder just can match the archetypal sincerity nor the outlandish imagination of the films he trying to emulate here child of fire may not be his worst film but it certainly his least Summary:
In the movie 'Reservoir Dogs', there is a discrepancy in the order of events regarding the assigning of names to the characters. 

In one scene, Orange (played by Eric Stoltz) tells a joke to three other characters in a bar, as part of an audition to join their team. The team leader, Joe, assigns names to everyone, including Orange. Later, when Orange meets Joe's boss, Holdaway (played by Harvey Keitel), Holdaway mentions the joke and says Joe assigned names after telling the joke. In a separate scene, Eddie (played by Chris Penn) refers to a character named Pink, who is played by Steve Buscemi, but this is supposed to happen before the team names were assigned. 

This discrepancy has no impact on the plot but may indicate a sloppy editing job.

Post Body: not perfect ll get into that later but damn was it impactful heartbreaking ode to parental devotion and an urgent call for climate action the end we start from plays well as more hopeful version of children of men admittedly that was one of the flaws had with the film as it does not show enough honest depictions of how humanity would actually deal with the end of the world rape murder thieving etc and its more idealistic tone did put me off as manipulative the film can get very repetitive at times when it focuses on just the main character and her baby the supporting characters have no personality and disappear as soon as they re introduced the symbolism connecting motherhood with water got grating bit and did not think the main character had much chemistry with the other characters but everything else they got right they got spectacularly right jodie comer gives the best performance of her career much like reese witherspoon in wild she in every frame of the film and the physical toll on her is immensely portrayed stripped away from the accents and big acting she been known to do it an entirely subtle performance that relies on her body language and her silence to convey what she thinking of what she does in the last minutes will leave you devastated no mince of words here she should win an oscar for this production values especially for an indie are wonderful art direction is realistic cinematography shot on film is gorgeous in its own destructive way sound design is impactful editing does great job conveying the poetry essence of the film yeah not perfect but worth checking out primarily from career best from jodie comer
Summary:
Despite its flaws, the film starts from an impactful ode to parental devotion, and urgent call for climate action with themes addressing humanity's reaction to the end of the world. The performance of Jodie Comer is the main highlight, portraying motherhood in a realistic and subtle performance through her body language and silence conveying the physical toll of her character. 
The film's art direction and cinematography is also worth noting, shooting on film with gorgeous cinematography capturing the essence of poetry. 
It's not perfect, but it's worth checking out.

Summary:
Countdown to Looking Glass is a movie that simulates a television broadcast from the year 1983, in which a terrorist bombing in Saudi Arabia escalates into a potential nuclear war between the United States and Russia. The movie is unique in that it features real political and military figures, adding to its realistic portrayal. The story builds to a tense and dramatic climax, leaving audiences with a sense of the dire consequences of poor diplomatic decision making. 

People who have seen this movie generally appreciate its realistic and unique style, enhanced by the inclusion of actual news footage and interviews with experts. However, some feel that the plot is somewhat dated and predictable, and that the ending is not as strong as it could have been. 

Overall, Countdown to Looking Glass is a noteworthy addition to the genre of nuclear brinksmanship films, offering a unique blend of realism, drama, and political intrigue.
